loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 51 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 57-year-old single mother with seven children. The oldest is 34 and the youngest is 17.

Being a single mother is not an easy job. She supported and raised her children alone when her husband left her by working as a beautician in a salon. Now that most of her children are grown-ups and have their own families, and due to old age, she decided to resign from her job and put up a sari-sari store (grocery store). Her sari-sari store (grocery store), which gains her a net of PHP 200 daily, is her only source of income nowadays, since her other children cannot support her expenses and her youngest in schooling. Their low income barely support their own families. 

She wanted to expand and add a rentals of tables and chairs and sell other party supplies. She wanted to grab the opportunity of being the first in her community to have a party supplies business and increase her income.
  
She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 23,000 to buy 50 bags of balloons, 100 bags of birthday caps, 50 pieces sample souvenirs, and 150 tables and chairs for children to sell for birthday needs.

Teodora wanted to maintain her business to help them in their daily expenses, the education of her youngest, and saving up for her old age and health.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of balloons, 300 birthday caps, 50 pieces sample souvenirs, and 150 pieces of tables and chairs for children to sell for party supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 50 years old with five children. The oldest is 29 and the youngest is 17 years old. She used to work as a domestic helper abroad but after years of longing for her family, she wnet home to stay.   

Emily has savings, but with no income coming she knows it will be spent for expenses, so she used her savings to put up a RTW (buy and sell  clothes) and sell it to her neighbors on weekly payments. With PHP 20,000 working capital she earns a net of PHP 3,000-4,000 weekly. More customers are ordering clothes from her because of the low price and she wanted to expand her business to increase her income but the lack of capital prevents her from doing so.

Her first loan amounting to PHP 6,000 was used as an additional capital to her RTW (buy and sell clothes). 

Through a series of loans, Emily's RTW (buy and sell clothes) expanded and now she is earning a net of PHP 6,000-7,000 per week. She also added frozen goods which she sells: sausages, hot dogs, and sweetened preserved pork. She built a food cart her husband operates to sell burgers and hot dog sandwiches. Most of all, through the revenue of the income, her children continue their education which gives them great joy.

Emily is requesting a re-loan amounting to PHP 35,000 to buy two dozen blouses, one dozen pants, one dozen shorts, and twelve dozen underwears to fill the orders of her customers, thus increasing her income.

Emily hopes to maintains her growing business to provide for her family and save for the continuing education of her children.

loans.use: To buy two dozen blouses, one dozen pants, one dozen shorts, and twelve dozen underwears to fill the orders of her customers

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es soltera, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados y por la noche estudia la licenciatura en kinesiología,  gracias a su trabajo ella puede estudiar.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Nilda is single. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo and works selling clothing and footwear. At night, she goes to college to study kinesiology. Thanks to her work, she is able to study. She is very responsible and dedicated to her studies and her family. She dreams of being a good professional and to continue studying and helping people. She is asking for a loan to pay her college tuition payments to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: To pay college tuition payments.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Gricelda es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que se esta preparando y esta estudiando para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad. Es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en el pago de sus cuotas, y hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para volver a pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con su meta de estudios.
texts.en: Gricelda is a person who is doing her best to be someone in life, which is why she is preparing herself and studying to be a professional who is useful to society.  She is a very giving and hardworking person and she tells us that she used her previous loan to pay her fees and she is now requesting a loan to pay her fees again and thereby continue to pursue her goal of studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek has led the Berawan Salak Permai group for several loan cycles and now they are paying off all the loan together. During six months of maintaining the pigs, they kept them well. Nutritious feed and vitamins are two things that need serious attention from the breeder. It makes the pigs grow as expected and they earned a satisfactory profit.

Ni Kadek, beside working as a breeder, also works in the garden with her husband. She will save all the profit and will use it for business capital. She has a dream to become a successful pig breeder with her own money. To make it real, Ni Kadek, together with other members of Berawan Salak Permai, decided to continue their loan. Ni Kadek will use her loan to purchase superior piglets and feed. She hopes for the best and her dream can come true. 

The group also expects a vet who can visit them regularly. Two members are not in the picture because they are  in the temple for a religious ceremony.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a helpful woman who always care for her relative’s needs. She manages a beauty parlor in the market and selling of various weaved goods. 

According to Luzviminda, her income is not enough to sustain her needs, but with her desire to extend her helps to her relatives.

Luzviminda offers hair cutting, coloring, and other hair styling services. She has two beautician who assist customers in their salon. 

She wants to improve service to customers. Luzviminda is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy materials needed in her beauty salon. 

Luzviminda believes that her relatives deserve help; that’s why she will not get tired of helping them.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline offers street food within her local community. She is 55 years old,married and blessed with six children.

Evangeline really works hard to improve her family's quality of life. While food vending has been her primary source of income, she plans to start a variety store.

With her determination to achieve her goal, she is requesting for a loan of PHP5,000 to buy "balut" (boiled eggs) and other street foods for her business and to get her variety store going.

She knows that this financial assistance will contribute a lot to her business.

loans.use: to buy street foods for her food vending business and buy items for her new variety store.

loans.name: Oscar Yndalecio

texts.es:
Oscar Yndalecio tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucalá, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de artesanía, miel de abeja, algarrobina y polen, cuenta con clientes de la zona y distritos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de dichos productos en mayor cantidad y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar Yndalecio is 39 years old and lives together with his wife in the district of Pucalá, in the Province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. The population in this area farm, trade, and raise livestock. Oscar sells handicrafts, honey, carob syrup (algarrobina,)  and bee pollen. He has clients in his area and the surrounding districts. He has requested a loan to buy the aformentioned products in greater quantities to offer to his clients, generating more revenue for his family which will help them improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts, honey, and carob syrup in greater quantities to offer to his clients.

loans.name: Erlan Ivan

texts.es:
Erlan tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de La Florida en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de transporte urbano con su motocicleta, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una moto más como una herramienta de trabajo adicional para incrementar su negocio, con esto Erlan espera mejorar la calidad de sus servicios lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Erlan is 20 years old, single, and lives with his family in the district of La Florida in a rural area located in San Miguel Province, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains.  Its inhabitants work in farming, livestock, and commerce.  

He offers urban transportation services on his motorcycle.  He has over three years of experience in this business and he has good personal and professional references in his district.  He is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle to serve as an additional work tool to expand his business.  With this, Erlan hopes to improve the quality of his services, which will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle to serve as a work tool to expand his business

loans.name: Segundo Dario

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su cónyuge en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la preparación y venta de picarones (dulces típicos de la región) además de la venta de limones, realiza esta actividad desde hace 01 año contando con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de insumos para preparar los picarones así como para la compra de una mayor cantidad de limones, con esto Segundo espera incrementar el stock de su negocio lo que le va a permitir mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 22 years old, in a relationship, and lives in his own home with his three children and his partner in a rural area of the district of Oyotún.  This is a community of farmers, ranchers, and merchants and it is located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.  

He makes and sells picarones (typical regional candies) for a living, as well as selling limes.  He has had this business for a year and he has experience in this work and good references in the district.  He is requesting this loan to buy a larger amount of ingredients to make his picarones, as well as to buy a larger amount of limes.  With this, Segundo hopes to increase his business's stock, which will allow him to increase his profits and thereby his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of ingredients to make his picarones, as well as to buy a larger amount of limes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 22 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Christine has run a general store business in the Philippines for two years. She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase biscuits, soft-drinks, sardines and other items.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, soft-drinks, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Guilerminha

texts.en:
A USD 600.00 loan is offered to Guilerminha to improve her business. She is married and she has four children and she has a business where many people come to buy every day. 

She will buy stock such as  gasoline and diesel. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Guilerminha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has three children and is married. 

As a group leader, Joan represents 10 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Joan's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing two solar lights as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits that Joan gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Joan and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights and inputs to support maize farming on a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase nine solar lights and inputs to support maize farming.

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily started her small-time business and has become successful in managing her sari-sari store. She has to ensure that she has enough inventory to serve her customers well. She rolls up her capital and additional revenue to gain more profit. 

Every day, Arcily makes good sales because of her good salesmanship. Recently she approached Paglaum for some much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities, and to pay for sacks of rice and animal feed. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, and to pay for sacks of rice and animal feed.

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela lives happily with her husband and three children. Buying and selling used bottles and scrap is her main source of income. 

Michaela is proud to share that through her income she is able to send her children to school and now already they have finished their college education. Michaela wishes to employ her children as soon as possible for them to experience working and have decent jobs. 

At present, Michaela still wants a continuous source of income to bestow their needs. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy used bottles, scrap, and many more things. Michaela will use her earnings to fix her children's requirements for employment. It will be a big help for her to have the loan.

loans.use: to buy used bottles, scrap, and many more things.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está viviendo con sus padres y comenta que está estudiando la licenciatura en nutrición, ella comenta que quiere habilitar su propio consultorio nutricionista y estudiar didáctica universitaria superior y enseñar en las universidades.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con esto poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Marta is from the city of San Ignacio.  She lives with her parents and she tells us that she is studying for her degree in nutrition.  She tells us that she wants to set up her own nutritionist practice and study higher education at university and teach in universities.  

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can keep studying and keep getting closer to achieving her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 10 años en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto y obtendrá mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
David is 36 years old and lives in his own rustic home with his partner and their youngest son, who is 10, in the district of Pucará.  This is a community of farmers and animal raisers that is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains. 

He works in farming, specifically growing pineapples, with 10 years of experience in the profession and good references from the people who live in his district.  He will use the loan he receives for farm work, the application and incorporation of pesticide products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.  This will help him improve his crops physically, morphologically, and in terms of productivity, and it will also help him have a good harvest.  This will increase his yield and give him better quality produce that he will have no problem selling, which will provide him will better income that will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to use for farm work, applying and incorporating pesticide products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Maria has a buy and sell copra business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more copra to sell.

Maria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more copra to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 62 years old and married. Nelly works very hard to provide for herself.

Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods,  soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Ma. Delia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Phaustine's Group

texts.en:
Phaustine, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers, in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Phaustine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Phaustine plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

Altogether, Phaustine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking female entrepreneur with six children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, coffee, etc. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, including buy-and-sell charcoal. 

Delia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Liza works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store and raising pigs. Liza is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. for her restaurant business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.es:
Carlina está estudiando la carrera de enfermería con el propósito de tener un título en la mano para poder  trabajar en un lugar público y poder ser alguien mejor cada día más para poder ayudar a las personas.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar su vida y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de universidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlina is studying to be a nurse with the goal of having a degree in hand so she can work in a public place and better herself every day by helping people.  

She is giving her all to improve her life and be able to help her family. 

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina operates a motorcycle transport services. It is locally known as habal-habal. It is used to transport from one area to remote places. 

She is 43 year old with six children aged from 1 to 19 years old. She lives in Getafe, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy a side car for tricycle. In these way, she would have another source of income to rely on. Her income will improve and she can start to handle her finances better. She would be able to afford to buy more nutritious diets for the whole family and to continue paying for the school fee of her children.

Rufina dream is to own her own tricycle for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a side car for tricycle

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a businesswoman from Tangub. She is 65 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a good return that sufficiently supports her family in addition to her husband's income. Esterlita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now she has applied for a loan to her restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Esterlita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa had the skills and expertise in "polvoron" making, yet she did not have enough capital to make it for a business. As a mother from Oroquieta, she never gets tired of supporting and helping her husband in raising their family. Elisa joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a business making "polvoron". It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her product. Elisa has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients for her business to increase her inventory. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Today, other retail businesses sell her product, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her business to increase her inventory

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 57 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult age. Fe has been engaged in a snack processing and vending business for more than two years already. Fe earns approximately 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional main ingredients like milk, sugars and flours for her snack processing and vending business. Fe has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fe hopes to have a little stall for her snack-vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional main ingredients like milk, sugars and flours

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie, 38 years old, lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio with her husband and two children. She has found ways to attain an income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the additional capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January 2011. She became a Member in Good Standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she has applied for 7,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 38 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and one infant-age child in Labuyo, Tangub City. He is a farmer who plants rice, corn and vegetables. 

Roel wants to increase sales from his rice farm. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase herbicides and fertilizer, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 47 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Johna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Johna has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from making sacks and bags.

Johna aspires to save enough money in order to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 55 years old, married and has five children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise and feed.

Florencia has been raising livestock for 20 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise and feed.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old and has two children who are in school.

Aileen has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aileen has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish and new perfumes, incense and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Eva has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 59 years old and is married. She never gets tired of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is adequate enough to support the needs of her family. Elizabeth is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without a record of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales. Elizabeth continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 54 years old and single. She works very hard. 

Jelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Jelita has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Jelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Felvir

texts.en:
Felvir works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Felvir has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Felvir would like to save enough to provide a secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une une femme très vigoureuse et vit dans le la quartier de Vakpossito. Abla est âgée de 26 et mère de trois enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Abla prépare des beignets à base de la farine de blé qu’elle vend dans le quartier afin d’avoir un bon revenu. Abla achète son stock de farine trois fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander quelques sacs de farine de blé. Abla souhaite avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour favoriser une bonne éducation à ses enfants
texts.en:
Abla is a very willful woman who lives in the Vakpossito neighborhood. She is a 26-year-old mother of three children.

To contribute toward her family's development, Abla prepares fritters made from wheat flour, and sells them in the neighborhood to ensure a good income.

Abla restocks with flour three times a month at the market, and is requesting this loan to order a few bags of wheat flour.

Abla wishes to generate profits sufficient to ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy two bags of flour

loans.name: Ruchiel

texts.en:
Ruchiel is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store.  Ruchiel is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ruchiel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to puchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 45 years old and has four children. She is a woman and two of her children are in school.

Loida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Loida has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie works hard to support her family. Ana Marie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, canned goods, sugar, etc.

Ana Marie has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, canned goods, and sugar

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong is a 56-year-old married rice farmer who lives in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia.  She has cultivated rice for more than 14 years. She has five children, four of whom are working in a factory and one attends school. Her husband is 51 years old and he is also a rice farmer. Together, the family can earn around $22 per day. Kong would like to expand her rice farm, so she is requesting a loan to buy more farmland for rice cultivation.  With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy more farmland and earn more from her rice crops. In the future, she is going to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy more farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en: Arcelita has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earns for her family as well. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Arcelita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is 57 years old, married and lives in Tangub, Philippines. To earn a living, he has a business that involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to sustain their family needs. Vicente wants to repair their house for a decent and comfortable living quarters. He has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and nipa thatch. Vicente is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and nipa thatch

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her business like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her business like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Florentina is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café business.

Florentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Lorna has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en:
Roselyne, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With her portion of this loan, Roselyne will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Roselyne plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total, Roselyne’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lourdes is 49 years old and four of her children are in school.

Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of firewood business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell to customers.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and four kids, one son and three daughters, in a small simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed items.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family hot water without using electricity.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children now at their adult age.

Alicia earns her living from a dressmaking business and she's been in this business for 20 years already. Alicia earns approximately PHP 9,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional cloth, zippers, linings and thread for her dressmaking business.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her dressmaking business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, zippers, linings and thread.

loans.name: Gs Guano Group

texts.es:
El Sr Fredy tiene 48 años de edad habita en la aldea  El Guano, Trojes al oriente de Honduras, y se dedica al comercio de productos  Lácteos y Ganadería,  y se dedica a estas actividades desde hace 10  Años.
Don Fredy el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de Melaza, Pasto, Vitaminas y Fertilizantes para su negocio.
Don Fredy espera que con la ayuda del préstamo pueda tener mejor producto que sus vacas estén fuertes y saludables y que proporcionen mejor leche ya más abundante.
La Sra. Juana de 42 años de edad se dedica a la caficultura, desde hace 15 años, y solicita el crédito para la compra de Fertilizantes para su finca.
La Sra. Concepción, de 48 años de edad convive con su  Esposo y su fuente principal es la caficultura esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de Fertilizantes.
El Joven Fredy de 19 habita en la comunidad de El Guano, es soltero y se dedica a criar y engordar ceros y solicita el crédito para la compra de Cerdos, el al igual que su padre se dedican a la agricultura y son personas muy trabajadoras que están seguros que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajando duro.
texts.en:
Fredy, 48, lives in the village of El Guano, Trojes in the east of Honduras. He has made a living selling dairy products and livestock for ten years. Fredy is applying for a loan to buy molasses, grass, vitamins and fertilizers for his business. He hopes that with the help of this loan, he will have a better product because his cows will be strong and healthy, providing more milk of a better quality.

Juana, 42, has been growing coffee for 15 years. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farm.

Concepción, 48, lives with her husband and her main source of income is growing coffee. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers.

The younger Fredy, 19, lives in the community of El Guano. He is single and makes a living raising and fattening pigs. Just like his father, he works in agriculture. They are very hardworking people who are sure that their only way to get ahead is to work hard.

loans.use: to buy molasses, grass, vitamins and fertilizers for his business.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is 42 years old with two grown dependents. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities including canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, soap, mosquito repellant, beverages and condiments.   

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks like canned goods, rice, and soft drinks. These will help improve the stock in her store. More customers would like to shop and purchase, thus augmenting her income.  With these, she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency uses. 

Ma. Fe's dream is to handle her business properly for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, rice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue y su menor hijo en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Tiene 2 años dedicándose a este rubro y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y pobladores de la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de pollos para incrementar su negocio, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga, 50, lives in her own house made of rustic materials with her spouse and her young son in the district of Pucará, which is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly work in agriculture and raising animals.

She makes a living by raising and selling chickens. Her business is located in her home. She has been in this field for 2 years and she has good references from her clients and inhabitants of the area. She will use this loan to buy a larger quantity of chickens to expand her business. This will allow her to generate a higher income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of chickens to expand her business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child now school age. Teodora earns a living from her coconut and copra (dried coconut meat) buying and trading business. She's been in the business for 11 years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse. Teodora has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional coconuts and copra for resale. Teodora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to have a coconut and copra trading buying station.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and copra.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 50 years old and has seven children. Jacinta is married and has three children who are in school.

Jacinta is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jacinta has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jacinta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melanie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her stall.

Juliet has been in this business for six years. Juliet earns more income from fruit vending.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Lorena Noemi

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a vender ropa para adultos y niños/as, vive únicamente con su pequeña hija, es totalmente independiente, su negocio tiene 15 años de estar funcionando y está ubicado en el mercado municipal de la cuidad, trabaja de lunes a domingo y lo atiende sola.
Invertirá en camisas, vestidos, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, etc., podrá aumentar la competitividad de su negocio y  tener a sus clientes satisfechos, con lo que espera aumentar sus ventas y estabilizarse económicamente.
Su objetivo es adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos para ir mejorando su negocio y pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Lorena sells clothing for adults and children. She lives with her young daughter and is completely independent. Her business has been open for 15 years and is located in the main market of the city. She works alone from Monday to Sunday.

She will invest in shirts, dresses, skirts, blouses, underwear, etc. to increase the competitiveness of her business and keep her clients satisfied. With this investment, she hopes to increase her sales and achieve financial stability.

Her goal is to gain experience in the use of loans to continue improving her business and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, dresses, skirts, blouses, underwear, etc. to increase the competitiveness of her business and keep her clients satisfied.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.pt:
O senhor Patricio tem 35 anos de idade, é casado pai de 5 filhos, 3 dos quais a estudar e os outros 2 ainda menores. Além dos filhos sustenta 1 irmão  que vive com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar vacinas, rações e  pintos para a criação que e feita num pavilhao arrendado.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são crescer na vida, ter aviario proprio na sua casa e construir um sistema de irrigação na sua machamba. 
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz  poupança e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Patricio, 35, is a married father of five children, three of whom are studying and two of whom are still young. Aside from his children, he also supports one brother who lives with him in his own house.

He says that he will use this loan to buy vaccines, chicken feed and chicks to raise in a rented pavilion. 

His dreams and hopes for the future are to grow in life, to have his own aviary in his house, and to build an irrigation system on his small farm. 

He says that his challenge is a lack of funds. To overcome this situation, he is saving and he will also apply for more loans to realize his plan.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé vit à Vakpossito  et est âgée de 35 ans. Ayélé est une femme mariée qui s’occupe de la charge de ses quatre enfants. Pour entreprendre une activité rémunératrice de revenu, Ayélé est une commerçante de gravier dans son quartier pour gagner son revenu. Ayélé renouvelle son stock six fois par mois afin d’avoir en permanence une grande quantité. Ayélé veut acheter un camion de gravier et demande ce microcrédit pour réaliser son attente et  réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice dans  son activité afin de soutenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayele lives in Vakpossito and is 35 years old. She is a married woman who takes care of her four children.

Ayele is a gravel merchant in her neighborhood as a means of generating income. She renews her stock six times a month in order to ensure a constant supply.

Ayele wants to buy a truckload of gravel. She is requesting this micro-credit loan to achieve her expectations and achieve a good profit margin through her activity, so she can support her children.

loans.use: buy one truckload of gravel

loans.name: Onelia

texts.pt:
A senhora Onélia tem 38 anos de idade, é casada mãe de 3 filhos com 17; 14; e 03 anos de idade, os 2 primeiros a estudar e vive com eles na casa própria. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar Revlon, Essequel, Darkinlove e bijuterias para reforçar os produtos do seu salão de beleza.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro ter um estabelecimento próprio uma vez que o actual está a arrendar, terminar a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura para o negócio e sustentar os estudos dos seus filhos.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz  xitique mensal como forma de poupar e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Onélia, 38, is a married mother of three children, ages 3, 14, and 17. Her two oldest children are studying and she lives with them in her own house. 

She says that she will use this loan to buy Revlon, Essequel, and Darkinlove products as well as jewelry to reinforce the products in her beauty salon. Her dreams and hopes for the future are to have her own establishment, since she is currently renting, as well as to finish construction and buy a vehicle for her business. She also hopes to support her children in their studies.

She says that her challenge is a lack of funds. To overcome this situation, she saves on a monthly basis with a "xitique" savings initiative and she will also apply for further loans to realize her plan.

loans.use: to buy Revlon, Essequel and Darkinlove products as well as jewelry.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Afi est une jeune femme célibataire sans enfant. Afi vit à Vakpossito pour entreprendre son activité pour répondre à ses besoins. Pour gagner sa vie, Afi vend des sacs vides aux clients et trouve son petit profit dans cette activité. Pour s’approvisionner Afi achète ses sacs trois fois par mois pour les revendre. Afi désire commander quelques sacs vides et sollicite pour accomplir ses attentes et avoir un resultat pour subvenir favorablement à ses besoins
texts.en:
Aged 38, Afi is a young single woman without children. She lives in Vakpossito where she undertakes activities to meet her needs.

To make a living, Afi sells empty bags to customers and finds some small profit in this business. She stocks up with bags three times a month for subsequent resale.

Afi wants to order some empty bags and is requesting this loan to fulfill her expectations and have a positive result so she can support herself.

loans.use: buy 48 empty bags

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галина, 60 лет, вдова, она счастливая мама 5 детей, уже есть и внуки. Образование- средне-специальное. С Галиной живет ее сын, он помогает по хозяйству, деятельность развита и приносит хорошую прибыль, также есть доход в виде пенсии по возрасту и заработной платы - Галина работает уборщицей в школе. В хозяйстве есть 2,40 Га, где Галина выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Галина обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита Галина планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en:
Galina is 60, widowed, and a happy mother of 5 children.  She already has grandchildren as well.  She has a secondary school education with some vocational training.  Her son lives with her and helps her with chores.  Her business is developed and brings in a good profit.  She also earns money from a pension related to her age and salary; she works as a cleaning lady in a school.  

Galina has 2.40 hectares of land on her farm, where she grows beans and clover as cash crops.  For the future development of her farm, Galina has requested a loan of 35,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to prepare the soil for growing organic produce.  She plans on putting the extra money due to the loan towards the future development of her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate her land and grow organic potatoes and haricot

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée et âgée de 30 ans. Afi vit à Avédji avec ses trois enfants et exerce son activité pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille. Coiffeuse, Afi vend des mèches et des produits de beautés. Afi s’approvisionne au marché quatre fois par mois. Afi demande ce prêt pour acheter des mèches et des pommades de beauté et satisfaire favorablement ses clients pour avoir une bonne rentabilité afin d’aider ses enfants à s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Afi is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in Avedji with her three children and runs her business to meet the family's daily needs.

A hairdresser, Afi sells hair extensions and beauty products. She resupplies in the market four times a month.

Afi is requesting the loan to buy hair extensions and beauty ointments to satisfy her customers and ensure good profitability, so she can help her children thrive.

loans.use: buy 30 ointments and 10 dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Mariée, Amavi est âgée de 23 ans et avec un enfant à sa charge. Amavi habite dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Amavi vend des sacs dans le quartier et au marché pour trouver un revenu pouvant couvrir leurs charges quotidiennes. Amavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois. Pour avoir plus de revenu, Amavi demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs destinés à la vente et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
23-year-old Amavi is married with one dependent child. She lives in the Adidogome neighborhood.

Amavi sells bags in the neighborhood and in the market to generate income to cover their daily expenses. She resupplies three times a month.

Seeking to increase her income, Amavi is requesting this loan to buy bags for resale, so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: buy 40 bags

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 27-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Fadel works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the things they need.

Fadel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity.

Fadel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Josselyn Abigail

texts.es:
Josselyn, vive con su madre, es acompañada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, tiene una venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de su mamá, y es así como puede generar ingresos para cubrir algunas necesidades familiares.
Comprará maíz, cal, leña y una plancha para hacer pupusas, contara con los materiales básicos para mantenerse trabajando y poder iniciar otro rubro, como lo es la venta de pupusa, el fin de hacer dicha inversión es generar nuevos ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda y apoyara a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son equipar su negocio para aumentar la rentabilidad y satisfacer las peticiones de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josselyn lives with her mother, is in a relationship and has a 4-year-old child.  She's had a tortilla-selling business for two years, and learned the trade with her mother's help.  It's with this business that she's able to generate income to pay for some family necessities.

She will buy corn, lime powder, firewood and a griddle for making pupusas, and will also buy basic supplies to keep working and be able to start a second business selling pupusas.  The purpose of making this investment is to generate new income, which she'll use to pay off her debt and help her husband with the family expenses.  Her aspirations are to outfit her business to make it more profitable and satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.use: buy corn, lime powder, firewood, a griddle for making pupusas, and basic supplies to keep working and be able to start a second business

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Maria Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Maria Theresa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

Maria Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred is 57 years old and has eight children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Alfred has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Alfred also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Alfred's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mirriam's Group

texts.en:
Mirriam is 38 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Mirriam has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mirriam also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Mirriam's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Meredeth

texts.en:
Meredeth is 45 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Meredeth has a food stall business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Meredeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like dried fish, vegetables and other spices.

In the future, Meredeth would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like dried fish, vegetables and other spices.

loans.name: Carlyn

texts.en:
Carlyn is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carlyn has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like sugar, flour and other spices.

In the future, Carlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour and other spices.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 55 years old, and is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Celsa has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zoher

texts.en:
Zoher is a 41-year-old married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife and kids in a small, simple house. Zoher works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the stuff they need.

Zoher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity.

Zoher appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and has three children. She comes from Kisumu.

Nancy has a food stall, and has had this business for the last seven years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000 which she uses to support her customers. Nancy has applied for her first loan of KES. 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more foodstuffs so as to supply more of her clients.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs so as to supply more of her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and animal feed to feed his cattle for increased milk production for his customers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 33-year-old married woman. She has five children, aged from 12 to 2 years old. 

Marites engages in farming. She toils the land and grows vegetables such as beans, eggplant and bitter gourd. In addition to farming, she also engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to have supplemental income. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets. These will help Marites and her family improve her ongoing catch. 

Marites hopes that her existing business will be properly managed for her to send all her children to college for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Arlene requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 54 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, chips, soft drinks, etc. Fely has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 57 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosie has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Rosie has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like soap, candies, sugar and other groceries.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, candies, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Henry, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. He is 57 years old, is married and has 8 children.

Henry likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Henry plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a goat.

In total, Henry’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 10.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Maria Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ganado y cultivo de granos básicos, es un negocio que heredó de sus padres desde hace más de 30 años, el trabajo en el campo requiere de experiencia para aprovechar todos los recursos  y mantener vigente su negocio, las propiedades en que trabaja le pertenecen. María es casada, su familia está integrada por su esposo y cinco hijos de 19, 17, 13, 8 y 5 años de edad, todos se esfuerzan para realizar los trabajos agrícolas.
Comprará una vaca parida, considera que la inversión le será de ayuda para fortalecer su negocio, en este momento cuenta con alimento suficiente para sus animales, lo que le facilitara su cuido, los riesgos son enfermedades que afecten a los cerdos y al ganado o plagas que afecten a sus cultivos.
Sus objetivos son mantener su negocio activo para tener los ingresos necesarios para dar a sus hijos oportunidades de superación en la sociedad.
texts.en:
María works raising pigs and cattle, and also growing basic grains. It is a business that she inherited from her parents more than 30 years ago. Working in the fields requires experience to take advantage of all the resources and keep her business current. The property in which she works belongs to her. María is married, and her family is made up of her husband and five children who are 19, 17, 13, 8 and 5 years old. All of them put in the effort to carry out the agricultural work.

María wants to buy a calved cow. She believes that the investment will help to strengthen her business. At the moment she has enough feed for her animals, which will help care for them. The risks include illnesses that affect pigs and cattle or infestations that could affect her crops. Her objectives are to keep her business active in order to have the necessary income to give her children opportunities to better themselves in society.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow to help strengthen her business.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su compañero de vida, es una persona muy responsable dentro de su comunidad, su actividad económica es el cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, oficio que aprendió de sus padres y desde hace 6 años lo realiza de manera independiente, trabaja de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde, su ventaja es que no paga obreros ya que sus actividades las realiza con la ayuda de su pareja.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tres cerdos para fortalecer la porqueriza, así como también invertirá en maíz al mayoreo para revenderlo, pretende aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio y tener nuevos ingresos para ir disminuyendo sus deudas y las necesidades de su familia.
Sus sueños son formar un patrimonio para que sus futuros hijos puedan tener una buena alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her life partner. She is a very responsible person in her community. She works growing basic grains and raising pigs, which she learnt from her parents. Six years ago she started to work independently. She works from 7am to 2pm. The advantage is that she doesn't pay labourers since she can carry out the tasks with the help of her partner.

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy three pigs to expand the pigsty, as well as buying corn in bulk to re sell. She wants to increase the profitability of her business and have new incomes to decrease her debts and her family's needs. Her dream is to build a heritage so that her future children can have good food, clothes, health and education.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and corn in bulk.

loans.name: Matthew's Group

texts.en:
Matthew is 75 years old and has 8 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Matthew has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Matthew also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Matthew's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living to help her husband, she has been running a sari-sari store business (general store) for five years already.This business helps them a lot in providing the needs of her family. She decided to take a loan again to buy additional good items for the store, to increase her store inventory and increase her income. 

In the future, Julieta wants to expand her business, and using her income she wants to renovate her store building.

loans.use: to buy additional good items for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 26 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Myra has a business growing vegetables in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Myra has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Myra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tailoring. 

Araceli requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Araceli dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 38 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by five farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Everlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Everlyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Everlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali had completely repaid his first loan to Kiva lenders, which he took to buy more items of food items for his small grocery store. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for the first loan because his profits increased, and because he could expand his business through opening a small cafeteria in a part of the same grocery store. Now, Ali can sell quick, light meals as well as tea, alongside selling grocery items. By that loan, the living conditions of his family had improved. 

Ali applied for a second Kiva loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy cafeteria and grocery items to be able to meet the demands of his customers. This loan will enable him to flourish his business more, and he can guarantee better living conditions for his children. Ali hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to buy cafeteria and grocery items to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 31 ans. Habitant à Vakposito, Elisabeth est une mère de quatre enfants à sa charge et travaille activement pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Elisabeth prépare et vend du soja en parcourant tout son quartier afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients.
