She started by making sports shirts and selling them at the local market and a little later on, she managed to accumulate many clients and have a full order book. As a result, she does not have time to sell her goods at the market.
To honour certain special orders, she needs a loan to purchase the different coloured fabrics (citizen). In addition, she plans to open a real clothing manufacture workshop because at present she uses her home.
Lalaina is a very hard-working and creative woman, for she does the silk screen creation herself.
She is married with three children. Her husband is a haulier and all her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy citizen sports shirts fabric of different colours.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to weed, mulch, and harvest.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Très dynamique et active, Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 32 qui vit à Vakpossito. Yawa est mère de deux enfants et travaille pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Yawa prépare du riz et de l’haricot pour vendre afin un revenu nécessaire pour leur survie. Yawa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de riz et des bols du haricot, Yawa demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une plus grande rentabilité pour aider sa famille
texts.en:
Very energetic and active, Yawa is a 32-year-old married woman living in Vakpossito. She is a mother of two and works for her children’s well-being.

To reach her goals, Yawa cooks rice and beans to retail, providing them with the necessary revenues for their subsistence. Yawa procures her supplies three times a month from the market.

Yawa is requesting this loan to purchase bags of rice and bowls of beans, so as to reach her objectives, increase the profitability of her business, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and four bowls of beans.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est âgée de 51 ans et vit à Vakpossito. Veuve, Afi a trois enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider leur permettre une bonne condition de vie. Afi vend des produits d’alimentations générales devant son domicile afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Afi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour acheter des sacs de maïs et des cartons de tomates, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Afi is 51 years old and lives in Vakpossito. Widowed, she has three dependent children; she works energetically to guarantee them good living conditions.

Afi retails grocery products in front of her house to generate a good beneficiary margin. She procures her supplies three times a month from the market in Lomé.

Afi is requesting this loan to purchase bags of corn and boxes of tomatoes. She will thus reach her goal to make a profit to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn and three boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She is a single mother blessed with three children of 15, 12 and 9 years.
         
She has had a green grocery business for 10 years, earning monthly income of KES 35,000. She has borrowed KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her first loan, which she will be using to purchase green peas, oranges, pineapples and sugarcane. 

She hopes that with the anticipated profits, she will be able to provide food for her family, pay school fees for her children and expand the current business as she repays her loan. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well expanded business and better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase green peas, oranges, pineapples and sugarcane

loans.name: Afi Adoudé

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des produits de beauté pour répondre aux désirs des clients, Afi Adoudé âgée de 59ans demande un premier crédit à WAGES. Elle espère ouverture une boutique de vente de produits et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Elle a démarré en 1999 et a pour mari un commerçant.
texts.en: In order to purchase beauty products to satisfy her customers’ needs, Afi Adoudé, who is 59 years old, requests a first loan from Wages. She hopes to open a shop for selling the products and to ensure the well-being of her family. She started her business in 1999 and her husband is a salesman.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Gs Defensores De La Fe Group

texts.es:
La Señora Dilma Aracely, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de 2  hijos, convive con su esposo.  Su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad.
Doña Dilma con el crédito que nos a solicitado le permitirá tener un mayor surtido en el negocio con Frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, café, pan, queso, plátanos, jabón, papel de baño, detergentes, refrescos, churros, condimentos y otros productos de consumo básico y esto le vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos en el hogar, lo que le permitirá cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros contraídos.
Doña Dilma su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a su hijos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.
Dinny, ella cuenta con una pequeña pulpería.
Rosa, ella tiene una pulpería.
Todos ellos tienen el mismo negocio solo que en diferentes lugares y con ellos ayudan a sus familia a cada día salir adelante con esfuerzo y trabajo.

                                                                                           Trojes, Honduras - Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Mrs. Dilma Aracely is 45 years old, the mother of two children, and lives with her husband. She sells staple goods and has been doing this for ten years. With the loan she has requested, Dilma will be able to buy a better assortment of items for her store including beans, rice, sugar, shortening, flour, coffee, bread, cheese, plantains, soap, toilet paper, detergents, soft drinks, chips, condiments and other basic food items. This will lead to more income for her household so she can cover the family's expenses and meet certain financial obligations. 

Dilma's dream is to provide a good professional education for her children and to improve her and her family's living conditions. The support she receives from the loan will help her realize her dreams. 

Dinny has a small grocery store and so does Rosa. All three of them run the same kind of business but in different places. Every day with effort and hard work they help their families get ahead.
Trojes, Honduras - March 2015

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, shortening, flour, coffee, bread, cheese, plantains, soap, toilet paper, detergent, soft drinks, chips, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain his vehicle which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to her increasing customers.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Jonalyn earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains for her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Babyflor

texts.en:
Babyflor is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Babyflor is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Babyflor has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Babyflor has been in this business for two years. In the future, Babyflor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Famille Samunane Group

texts.fr: Pour prendre en charge ses études et celles de ses frères et soeurs, Gérance a commencé à cultiver le café en 2001. Grâce à cette activité, leur famille est respectée. Ils organisent les différents travaux avec sa maman (voir photo) et estiment que grâce à ce crédit, ils pourront résoudre le problème lié au sarclage pour l'instant et d'autres s'en suivront un peu plus tard (taillage). Il souhaite construire une maison et se marier.
texts.en: To cover schooling costs for him and his brothers and sisters, Gérance started to grow coffee in 2001. Thanks to this work, their family is respected. They organize different work project with their mom (see photo) and think that, because of this loan, they will be able to resolve the problem related to weeding for the moment, and others will follow a bit later (pruning). Gérance would like to build a house and get married.

loans.use: to pay for weeding

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carla is 33 years old now.

Carla has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

Carla has been in this business for five years. In the future, Carla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Minilen

texts.en:
Minilen is 36 years old and a housewife with three children. Minilen also takes care of her aunt with brain and developmental problems (special child). Her husband works abroad to support their family. 

She’s been a SEED partner for three years, and her first loan was used as additional working capital for her sari-sari store (grocery store) to help them in their expenses until last year, when she and her husband abroad experienced matrimonial problem that cause her and her family distress. She tries to resolve her matrimonial problem herself, but it only gives more sparks to a building flame. Minilen tries to be strong for her children and open again her sari sari store (small grocery store) and rugs business, from which she used to gain a net of PPP 400-500 daily. Minilen wants to start again.

Minilen is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy 5 sacks of rice, 30 gallons of mineral water, 5 trays of eggs and 5 cases of soft drinks as additional items she can sell from her store to increase her income.

Minilen wanted to get back her life and be strong to support and raise her children. With all the help from her family and friends, in a matter of time she can make it through and come out successful.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice, 30 gallons of mineral water, 5 trays of eggs and 5 cases of soft drinks as additional items she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. Magdalena has been in this business for eight years now. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase seaweed, plastic rope, bamboo, etc. In the future, Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed, plastic rope, bamboo, etc., for her seaweed culture business

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Cruz María, tiene 42 años de edad, convive con su compañero de hogar Su actividad principal es la caficultura, cuenta con más de 4 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad  a su vez cuenta con una pequeña pulpería  donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica familiar cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio.
Doña Cruz con el crédito que nos a solicitado le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de fertilizantes y abonos para su cafetal  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos que esta adquiriendo con esta institución.
Doña Cruz su sueños es tener bien surtido su negocio permitiéndole tener mayor clientela, lo que le generaría mejorar sus ingresos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, y así sentir el apoyo que prisma de Honduras y KIVA le estarían brindando.

                                                                            
                                                                                   Trojes  Honduras Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Cruz María is 42 years old and live with her partner. Her main work is growing coffee, and she's been doing this for more than four years. She also has a small grocery store where she sells basic goods. She has a good customer base because her business is strategically located in a high-commerce area.

With the loan she's asking us for, Cruz will have a better stock in her business and be able to carry out her fertilizer and compost projects for her coffee fields. This will allow her to improve her income to cover family expenses and the commitments she's gaining with this institution.

Cruz's dream is to have a well-stocked business, allowing her to have more customers which will improve her income and her and her family's living conditions. The support she receives from the loan will contribute to achieving her dreams and thus feel the support that Prisma de Honduras and Kiva are providing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for her coffee fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and small ruminants.

loans.name: Noeline

texts.fr:
48 ans, mariée, Noëline a un enfant déjà marié et deux neveux orphelins à sa charge. Ces derniers vont tous à l'école.
Ça fait 11 ans qu'elle vend des meubles, des congélateurs, des réfrigérateurs et d'autres équipements électroménagers d'occasions ou de 2ème main
Au tout début, elle commençait avec des chaussures d'occasions, friperies et ustensiles de cuisines déjà utilisés,
Puis petit à petit, elle investissait sur des meubles, des congélateurs  des réfrigérateurs d'occasion (appartenant à des étrangers qui devaient quitter le pays) et ceci a marché  jusqu'à aujourd'hui. Elle et son mari se soutiennent dans l'exercice de cette activité.
Elle veut encore investir et demande un crédit pour acheter des congélateurs, des réfrigérateurs et des bahuts en palissandre. Ces marchandises sont de bonne occasions et la plupart des gens préfère les bonnes occasions que les meubles neufs car c'est moins cher et de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
Noëline, aged 48, has a child who is already married, has two orphaned nephews to support. The latter are both attending school. For eleven years, Noëline has been selling furniture, freezers, refrigerators, and other household appliances, either used or to rent. Right off, she started with used shoes, secondhand clothing, and kitchen utensils previously owned. Then little by little she invested in used furniture, freezers, and refrigerators (owned by foreigners who had to leave the country), and it has gone well so far. She and her husband support each other in this business. 

Noëline still wants to invest and is asking for a loan to purchase some freezers, refrigerators, and rosewood cabinets. These items are used, and most people prefer used furnishings over new ones because of the cheaper price and good quality.

loans.use: to purchase freezers, refrigerators, and rosewood cabinets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many shoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Margaret has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Margaret described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light in addition to fertilizer and maize because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 11 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 57 years old. He is married with two children. He does farming and has been in the business for 30 years. His monthly income is 7,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is William's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to use on his farm for better yields. He plans to save the profits for the future, when he hopes to have a self-sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of sugar, rice, butter, milk, chicken, mortadella, and sod

loans.name: Haidhat

texts.fr: Femme de 48ans, Haidhat a 02 enfants majeur de 26 et 25ans. Pour apporter son aide à sa famille, elle revend depuis 2009 des canettes et eau minérale à Lomé. Elle approvisionne chez les grossistes et désire rendre pérenne son activité. A l'avenir, Haidhat espère ouvrir une seconde boutique avec l'épargne effectuée et fonder une famille bien stable.
texts.en: Haidhat, a 48-year-old woman, has two adult children, aged 26 and 25. To help out her family, she has been selling canned beverages and mineral water in Lomé since 2009. She gets her supplies from wholesalers and would like to make her business sustainable. For the future, Haidhat hopes to open a second store with savings and to have a really stable family.

loans.use: to purchase canned beverages and mineral water

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 46-year-old married, woman with nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a crafts business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy paint, premix, hardener, flywood, etc. to use for her business. She has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy paint, premix, hardener, flywood, etc. to use for her business

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Etant veuve et âgée de 37 ans, Massan est une mère d’un seul enfant et vivent ensemble à Agoè. Massan a comme activité la vente des condiments et des produits d’alimentations générales afin de subvenir aux charges régulières de son ménage. Massan s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Massan s’est vue dans le besoin d’approvisionner son étalage et a donc sollicité ce crédit pour acheter des paniers de tomates et des cartons de cubes  afin d’aider son enfant à bien s’épanouir dans la famille.
texts.en: A 37-year-old widow, Massan is a mother of one child, and they live together in Agoè. Massan has a business selling condiments and grocery items to cover regular household expenses. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. She is faced with the need to stock her shelves and thus is requesting this loan to purchase baskets of tomatoes and boxes of cubes [bouillion cubes] in order to help her child to thrive in the family.

loans.use: to purchase 3 baskets of tomatoes and 3 boxes of  of cubes

loans.name: Zipporah's Group

texts.en:
Zipporah is 55 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Zipporah has been farming with One Acre Fund for some years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Zipporah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Zipporah's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Kossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Kossiwa vit à Vakpossito pour exercer son activité de vente de céréales.  Ce commerce lui permet de venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire. Kossiwa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et du haricot, Kossiwa demande ce prêt pour acheter sa marchandise et avoir un bénéfice pour éduquer ses enfants
texts.en: At 42 years old, Kossiwa is married and the mother of two children. Kossiwa lives in Vakpossito in order to practice her trade of cereal sales. This business allows her to contribute to her family's needs and realise a good profit margin. Kossiwa obtains supplies three times a month at the market. In order to order bags of corn and beans, Kossiwa is asking for this loan to purchase her goods and reap a profit to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn and five bags of beans

loans.name: Dibeh

texts.en:
Dibeh is a 27-year-old, single Lebanese woman living with her parents and two siblings. 

She has been working at her home, selling European clothing from her house to help her family to meet their everyday needs. She is talented and has been working in this type of business since 2014. She is well-known in her region because of her good reputation. 

To develop her business, Dibeh is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy a new clothing collection in order to improve her business and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy a new clothing collection

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana.
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y con ello se gana la vida para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, y poder procurarle una mejor calidad de vida. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder capacitarse y ser mejores cada día.
Juana pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo y luchar por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
This group, formed in the city of Encarnación, is made up of very hardworking women who have come together to help their families and loved ones. They are part of the poverty elimination program, and one of these members is called Juana.

She sells assorted clothing, which allows her to earn a living to help her family and loved ones and to offer them a better quality of life. She is very grateful for this opportunity which will allow her to be better prepared and to improve every day.

She is requesting this loan to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers among other things, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing until now, and fight for a better life.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers etc.

loans.name: Askr

texts.en:
Askr has managed a pharmacy store in the capital city of Sana'a for more than five years. He works alone at it. In truth, his store lacks a lot of medicines and health equipment, but his capital is not enough to expand his business. 

Asker applied for a loan of 500,000 Yemeni rials from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase various kinds of medicines and health equipment for his pharmacy store to be able to meet the patients' needs. With this loan, his profits will increase and he will be able to create job chances in his community. Askr needs two employees inside the store to help him, and he hopes this loan will allow him to do that. 

Living in a very small apartment is bothersome for Askr and his family because they can't have their convenience. This loan will enable Askr to rent a larger and better apartment than the first one. Askr hopes to open another pharmacy store beside the first one to guarantee better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of medicines and health equipment for his pharmacy store to be able to meet the patients' needs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 23 years old, a woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina has a candle making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Cristina requested a 5,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items like wax, coloring, etc.  In the future, Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like wax, coloring, etc., for her candle making business

loans.name: Mercho

texts.en:
Mercho is 43 years old with six children (two of them are in school). She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from a restaurant.

Mercho has borrowed and repaid four loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested an 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, etc. Mercho hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, etc

loans.name: 13 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 13 de febrero se formó en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 17 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Paola es modista, es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya se hizo de mucha clientela. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y dar a su familia todo y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Paola pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.  Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group, called "13 de Febrero" was formed in the city of Villa Elisa, and is made up of 17 women who are all female heads of households who wish to give their loved ones what they were not able to have.

Paola is a seamstress. She is very good at what she does, which is why she already has a large number of clients. She is a very resourceful person who wishes to get ahead in life and give her family everything, so that all their needs are met.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, and elastics among other things, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing until now. 

She is very grateful for this opportunity which will allow her improve every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastics etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, salt, and tomato paste.

loans.name: Marcia Liset

texts.es:
Marcia Liset tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, como papa a la huancaína, cebiche, tallarines, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para el mejoramiento de infraestructura del local donde atiende a sus clientes, dicha inversión le servirá para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa en tener en mejores condiciones su negocio para poder satisfacer las necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia Liset is 32 years old, she is married and has one child. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, a rural zone where the residents work in agriculture, trade and raising livestock. It is located in the Province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She sells food for a living, such as Huancayo style potatoes, ceviche and noodles. She has more than five years of experience in the business and has good references from the residents of the area. 

She has asked for a loan to improve the infrastructure of the shop where she looks after her customers. The investment will help her give better attention to her customers, and will have a great impact on the business. She hopes to have her store in better condition to satisfy the needs, requirements and preferences of the customers in the area. This will have a positive impact on her level of income and finally, will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the shop where she looks after her customers.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eugenio tiene 49 años, está casado hace 23 años con la señora Mirian de 43 años de edad, del matrimonio tuvieron 6 hijos, todos ya mayores, que pudieron sacar adelante con su esfuerzo.
El señor Eugenio tiene su negocio de panadería desde hace 21 años, es un señor muy activo, trabajan en forma familiar todos los integrantes de la familia.   
El cliente pide este préstamo para la compra de harina, aceite, anís, levadura y otros para poder seguir haciendo sus panificados.
texts.en:
Señor Eugenio is 49 years old, and he has been married for 23 years to Señora Mirian, who is 43 years old. They have 6 children, who are now all grown, and through effort, they were able to provide for their children.

Señor Eugenio has had a bakery for 21 years. He is a very active man, and all of the members of the family work together in this business.

This client is requesting a loan to buy flour, oil, anise, yeast, and other things to be able to continue making his baked products.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, anise, yeast, and other things.

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Edem est une femme veuve âgée  de 38 ans. Avec ses deux enfants, Edem vit à Vakpossito pour vendre des draps et des produits de beauté dans le quartier et ses environs. Ce commerce lui procure le bénéfice et Edem s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Edem  sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des draps et des pommades qu’elle pourra vendre pour avoir un profit considérable et faire face à ses préoccupations.
texts.en: Edem is a 38-year old widow. With her two children, Edem lives in Vakpossito to sell sheets and cosmetic products in the neighbourhood and environs. This trade gives her an income, and Edem sources supplies three times a month at the market. Edem is asking for this loan in order to purchase sheets and ointments which she will then sell to obtain a significant profit and meet her obligations.

loans.use: to buy 30 sheets and 27 ointments

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama La Esperanza es un grupo que cuenta 18 integrantes, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, todas muy trabajadoras y con espíritu emprendedor. Son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona aun en crecimiento y eminentemente rural.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora Digna quien trabaja de forma independiente en su propia casa, ella es muy guapa, se dedica a la costura, confecciona ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, como también  hace uniformes para escuelas  y colegios de la zona, se la distingue por su buen trabajo, es por ello que tiene ya mucha clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This committee named La Esperanza is a group of 18 members. They are in the second cycle of loans, and all of them are very hardworking with an entrepreneurial spirit. The members are from the city of Santaní, an area that is still growing and very rural.

One of the members of this committee is Señora Digna who works independently from her home. She is very beautiful, and she makes a living as a seamstress. She makes clothes for women, men, and children, and also makes uniforms for schools and high schools in the area. She is distinguished for her good work, and for this reason she now has many clients.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy fabrics, threads, elastic bands, and other things. With this, she will be able to continue with the work that she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastic bands, and other things.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
La Señorita Ninfa es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y trabajando a la vez en una empresa en el área de contabilidad.
Tiene la meta de abrir para su propia empresa una vez terminada su carrera. Es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señorita Ninfa is a student majoring in Business Administration, and she is also working at the same time for a company as an accountant.

Her goal is to open her own business after she gets her degree. She is a person who is striving to be able to be someone in life. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for the fees of her getting her degree in order to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi âgée de 38ans vit avec son mari mécanicien et leurs 02 enfants de 16 et 11ans à Lomé. Les 02 enfants sont scolarisés. En 2012, elle a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle revend des céréales, des mortiers et des produits alimentaires. Son souhait est d'acheter un terrain et assurer le bien - être de la famille avec le profit réalisé.
texts.en: Essi, aged 38, lives in Lomé with her husband, a mechanic, and their two children, aged 16 and 11. Their two children are in school. Essi opened a store in 2012 where she sells grains, mortars, and grocery items at the retail level. Her wish is to purchase a plot of land and to ensure her family’s well-being through the profits she makes.

loans.use: to purchase grains, grocery items, and mortars.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Lorita

texts.en:
Lorita is 61 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lorita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Lorita has been farming rice for seven years and earns additional income from egg retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are in school. She is 54 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jacinta has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.

Jacinta has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years. She is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. She is 52 years old, is married, and has seven children.

Margaret likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Margaret plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Margaret’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Some members of the group will also purchase a solar light with this loan; the group will receive a total of five solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kos Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Soy is 49 years old. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school and another who is too young to attend school. She overcomes her family’s hardship by growing rice and cucumbers. She has been in this business for 31 years. 

This is the second loan for Soy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. In this group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy cucumber seed, pesticide and fertilizer to support her business. She hopes that she can expand her current business and earn more money to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seed, pesticide and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 33-year-old mother who has won the love of all of her neighbors because of her kindness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is the primary reason she fights every day and generates sustenance to survive. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to Racheal's heart. Every day she wakes up to milk her cows, and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit so she is seeking a loan to build one. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cows. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Racheal believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she will have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. 

With her drive and ambition, Racheal sees herself generating employment through hiring someone to help her in her dairy business. She waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 39-year-old woman with two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessica has a business buying and selling read-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Jessica has requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more used clothes to sell. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 29 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jinky is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jinky has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kimhav

texts.en:
Kimhav, 55, lives in Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. She has six children, four of whom are dependent on her. To make her living, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for 37 years, and it earns her about 20,000 riels per day. 

This is Kimhav's third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. She will spend her loan on fertilizer and seed to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more money to make her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, shea butter, oil, and pepper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new seat covers for his taxi.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité MADRES TRABAJADORAS, está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de esto podrán mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  
La Sra. Olga,  es una  las integrantes quien trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y ropas de todos los tamaños, para aumentar sus ingresos, y poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
A través del esfuerzo, el trabajo duro, las ganas de superación, el compromiso y la responsabilidad demostrada por la Señora Olga se destaca como una mujer líder dentro de su comunidad.
Olga pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas y cosméticos en cantidad para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Hardworking Mothers" is in its 4th loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees, where they are developing their businesses as a team and providing mutual support.  They are taking the Poverty Elimination Survey, and through this program they will be able to improve their living conditions.

Olga is one of the members of this group.  She works selling cosmetics and all sizes of clothing to increase her income so that she can give her family everything she could not have.  Because of her efforts, hard work, and will to succeed, and the commitment and responsibility she demonstrates, Olga is regarded as an outstanding leader in her community.  

Olga is requesting this loan to buy garments and cosmetics in bulk so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy garments and cosmetics

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es estudiante de la carrera de Enfermería, está casada, tiene un hijo pequeño, comenta que su marido trabaja como empleado y que siempre la apoya en sus estudios.
Ella es una persona que pese a las situaciones y a las adversidades quiere poder salir adelante. Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ana is a nursing student. She is married and has a young son. She says that her husband works, and he always supports her in her studies.

She is a person that, despite situations and adversities she faces, wants to be able to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for the fees of getting her degree and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Koffi Dodji

texts.fr: Koffi Dodji âgée de 39ans est informaticien de profession. En 2007, il a ouvert son cyber et se fait aidé par 01e personne. Il désire acheter des ordinateurs c'est pour cela, il demande un second prêt à WAGES. Il souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer l’éducation de ses frères.
texts.en: Koffi Dodji, aged 39, is a software developer by profession. In 2007, he opened a computer services establishment or internet café, and he has the help of one person. He would like to purchase some computers, so he is asking for a second loan from WAGES. He would like to expand his business and ensure schooling for his brothers.

loans.use: to purchase computers

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Concepcion has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Barikougni

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Barikougni est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Barikougni vit dans le quartier de Vakpossito pour faire son commerce de produits d’alimentation, du charbon et de tubercules. Barikougni s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses marchandises. Barikougni demande ce crédit commander des sacs de charbons de bois et des calebasses de tubercules afin de maximiser son profit et soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Barikougni, aged 30, is a married woman and the mother of three. She lives in the Vakpossito district to  do business in grocery items, charcoal, and tubers. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market for her merchandise. Barikougni is asking for this loan to order sacks of charcoal and bowls of tubers in order to maximize her profit and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and yams

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a 41-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of eight farmers from the Webuye district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Rehema has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rehema described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights in addition to fertilizer and maize because she will be able to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rehema’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 40 years old, and her child is in school.

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as biscuits, junk foods, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as biscuits, junk foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Esnas's Group

texts.en:
Esnas, featured in the picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers from Webuye district, Kenya. She is 37 years old and the married mother of six children. She is often described as a very trustworthy person. 

Although Esnas has been a farmer for 16 years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Esnas wanted to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Esnas hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights (even though Esnas decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package).

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 47 years old and widowed with nine children. Five of her children are in school.

Jona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

Jona has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jona aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic waste and resell it to recycling companies

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée  qui vit à Agoè avec trois enfants à sa charge. Abla est âgée de 55 ans et œuvre activement pour apporter sa contribution à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Abla vend des produits d’alimentation générale. Grâce à son petit commerce, Abla trouve une épargne pour favoriser son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Abla s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois marché. Dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfice, Abla demande ce crédit des bidons d’huile et des sacs de légumes
texts.en: Abla is a married woman who lives in Agoè with her three children to support. She is 55 years old and works actively to help her family to thrive. Abla sells grocery items. Thanks to her small business, she saves money for her husband to cover family expenses. She gets her supplies four times a month at the market. With the goal of making more profit, Abla is asking for this loan to acquire containers of oil and bags of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase spaghetti and condiments for her restaurant

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora y hogareña, esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de sus estudios quiere ir abriéndose camino en el mundo laboral.
Su objetivo es poder culminar sus estudios universitarios y poder seguir capacitándose día a día para poder brindar mejores servicios a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very hardworking and home-loving woman. She is studying accounting, and she wants to continue opening up paths to the work world through her studies.

Her goal is to be able to finish her university studies, and continue equipping herself day by day to be able to offer better service to people.

She is requesting this loan to be be able to pay for the fees of her degree and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beans to cook and sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de veterinaria, su meta es terminar la carrera y ser un doctor en veterinaria, es por esa meta que está luchando.
Actualmente trabaja en una agroveterinaria y por medio de su trabajo quiere ir abriéndose camino en el campo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera para poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Javier is studying in the fourth year of veterinary school. His goal is to finish school and be a veterinary doctor, and he is fighting for this goal.

Currently, he works in the agro-veterinary sector, and through his job he wants to continue opening up paths to work in rural areas.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay for the fees of his degree and be able to continue fighting for his goals.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet the demands of her clients for milk supply.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Divorcée, Ablavi est une femme de 37 ans qui vit à Agoè avec ses trois enfants. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Ablavi vend des  lampes torches au bord de la route et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Ablavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Ablavi désire ce microcrédit pour acheter des cartons de lampes torches afin de trouver le bénéfice pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants et  générer assez de revenus.
texts.en: Divorced, Ablavi is a 37-year old woman who lives in Agoè with her three children. In order to live and contribute to her children's needs, Ablavi sells flashlights by the side of the road and earns her income through this trade. Ablavi gets her supplies four times a month at the market. Ablavi woud like this microloan in order to buy boxes of flashlights so as to make a profit to further her children's education and generate enough income.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of flashlights

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has one child in school.

Luisa has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell like pants, etc.

Luisa has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell like pants, etc.

loans.name: Bebelonia

texts.en:
Bebelonia is 50 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

Bebelonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, soap and other groceries.

Bebelonia has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Bebelonia aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 46 years old with five children. She is a single mother and a hardworking entrepreneur. She sells breakfasts, such as porridge, soups, tofu and eggs, to help with the daily expenses and the schooling of her children. She is the only one supporting her children.

Marita's first loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) was used to put up a sari-sari store (grocery store) from which she makes a net of 200 to 300 PHP daily. Marita knows how to make rice cakes. She wants to sell rice cakes as an additional product which she can sell in her store and by travelling sales in her community. Marita is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy two sacks of rice, one sack of sugar, one bag of flour, plastic cups, and equipment for rice cake making. She hopes to expand her business to support her children's continuing education and expenses.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, one sack of sugar, three box of canned goods, one bag of flour, plastic cups and equipment for rice cake making

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 55 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, bread, beverages, etc.

Liza has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, bread, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bricks, tiles and cement for house construction.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuetra señora de la Asunción está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran en una situación de pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cesaria quien se dedica a las confecciones, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que le va muy bien y ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos. Cesaria está esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Cesaria pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Nuetra señora de la Asunción group is in its 6th loan cycle with the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire where 3 of the members are in a situation of extreme poverty.

One of the members is Cesaria who works making clothing. She is a person who is very good at what she does and for this, it is going very well for her and she has a well-established customer base that always orders a lot of things. Cesaria is working hard to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Cesaria asks for this loan to be able to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners, and more, with which she will be able to continue with her sewing as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners, and more.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Roque, está en su ciclo 11 dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
La Sra. Eva es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por su familia y por sus seres queridos, para poder darles una mejor vida. Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de toda clase de cosméticos, para así ir creciendo en su negocio, y concretar sus   proyectos y el   bienestar de su familia. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorar cada día en lo que hace.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Roque" is in its 11th loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees.  All of the members have promised to work and carry out activities to meet the group's common goals. 

Eva is a member of this group.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who fights for her family and for her loved ones so that she can give them a better life.  She is requesting this loan to buy all types of cosmetics so that she can grow her business and put her plans into action for the well-being of her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing and improving every day.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La señora Nilda tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá , tiene una Despensa bien surtida con clientes ya formados ya que la misma hace más de 12 años. 
Nilda tiene dos hijos, el cual uno está en el Brasil trabajando en costura y el otro se encuentra con ella. La señora Nilda es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que gracias a su trabajo y lucha ha podido dar a sus hijos todo lo que está a su alcance.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, carne, hortalizas, panificados y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nilda, 52, lives in the city of Ita.  She has a well-stocked store with an established customer base, because she's had the business for more than 12 years.

Nilda has 2 children, one of whom is working in Brazil as a dressmaker.  The other child lives with her.  Nilda is a very hardworking and enterprising person who, thanks to her work and efforts, has given her children everything she could.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to stock her store with vegetables, meat, bakery goods, and other items.  With this investment, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Triunfantes está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de los 50 indicadores.
Benita es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella hace comidas de todo tipo que empieza a elaborar desde muy temprano en el día, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas como lo viene haciendo. 
Ella al igual que sus compañeras del grupo agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben todas de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Triunfantes is in its 4th loan cycle with the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are part of the poverty elimination program where they are all completing the questionnaire of the 50 indicators. 

Benita is one of the members of this group. She prepares all sorts of food that she begins to make very early in the day, and later she goes out to sell it as a street vendor. She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, meat, seasonings, and more, to be able to continue making her food as she has been doing.

She, as with her partners in the group, is grateful for the opportunity that they are getting to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio tiene 25 años, está acompañado hace 1 año con la señora Claudia de 18 años, son una pareja joven que se están esforzando para poder abrirse camino e ir mejorando cada día.
El señor Julio es mecánico de moto desde hace 5 años   anteriormente trabajaba como empleado, luego junto un pequeño capital y formo su propio taller, luego al aumentar su ingreso empezó a traer repuestos para moto y eso le permite tener más clientes.-  
Julio solicita el préstamo para la compra de repuestos, como cadena, corona, piñón, cubiertas, aceite, ruleman, faros y otras cosas, que permite ofrecer más servicios a sus clientes y por ende mejorar su ingreso.-
texts.en:
Julio is 25 years old, he has been partnered with Claudia, 18 years old, for 1 year. They are a young couple and are working hard to be able to make their way and improve each day.

Julio has been a motorcycle mechanic for the past 5 years. Previously he worked as an employee, later he saved up a bit of capital and opened his own workshop, later to augment his income, he began to carry motorcycle spare parts and this allowed him to have more customers.

Julio asks for this loan to purchase spare parts such as chains, sprockets, pinions, covers, oil, ball-bearing, headlights, and more, which will permit him to offer more services to his customers and in the end increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as chains, sprockets, pinions, covers, oil, ball-bearing, headlights, and more.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Valentín  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, se formó en la ciudad de Itá, con un grupo de vecinas y amigas.
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Bianca, quien hace comidas de todo tipo, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que se esfuerza y lucha cada día. Ella quiere tener algún día un negocio de venta de comidas, para que pueda ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser, verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando en su pequeño emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Valentín group is its second cycle of the women's committee program, in which everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. It was formed in the city of Itá with a group of neighbors and friends.

Among them, Señora Bianca stands out. She makes all kinds of food, and then she goes out selling it as a mobile vendor. She is a very hardworking and determined person who wants to support herself. That's why she strives and works hard every day. She wants to one day have a shop selling food, so that she can keep getting better every day.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies so that she can make her meals; these include vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able keep growing and improving her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy millet

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 35 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a farming business for 14 years. She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs for crop production and hopes this will help her buy the farm she is currently cultivating. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a prosperous business woman able to feed for her family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for crop production to help her buy the farm she cultivates

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: For many years, Alice, has been engaged in mixed farming in the remote town of Kitale. In this way she supplements her meager income, with which she has gotten her children ahead in the world. Her tenacity and perseverance has enabled her to strive tirelessly, always looking for a way to get ahead. Her major sources of income are selling eggs, growing crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. Because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used to improve her living conditions. She plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish and provide a secure solid education for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Manuela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, home care products and other groceries.

Manuela has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Remedios is 63 years old now.

Remedios has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Remedios has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Angelina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like biscuits, canned goods and other groceries. Angelina hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Marfa

texts.en:
Marfa is a 40-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like wax, coloring, etc. to use in her business.

Marfa has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide future financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like wax, coloring, etc. to use in her business

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Juan está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas quieren ir mejorando su situación de pobreza por medio de su esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Esthela quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio del servicio de manicura que hace lucha por poder ir mejorando sus ingresos. Ella es una persona muy buena en lo que hace y es por ello que ya tiene mucha clientela, ella quiere tener algún día un salón de belleza.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, alicates y otros, y con ello poder seguir dando a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
The San Juan group is in its 12th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they are all completing the poverty elimination questionnaire where they all want to improve their poverty situation through their efforts.

One of the members is Esthela who, through her efforts and continual work, and through the manicure service that she does, struggles to be able to increase her income. She is a person who is very good at what she does, and for this reason already has a lot of customers. She wants to one day have a beauty salon. 

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of nail polish, nail polish remover, clippers and more, and with this be able to continue providing her customers with good service.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, clippers, and more.

loans.name: San Miguel 2 Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado San Miguel, donde todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rumilda, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. 
Rumilda por  medio de las ventas de ropas que hace, está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias, para que no les falte nada, y para que tengan una vida digna.
La Sra. Rumilda  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas en mayor  cantidad lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
There are 19 women who form this group called San Miguel, where they are all part of the poverty elimination program, where one of the members is Rumilda who, in her last questionnaire, showed a poverty level within level one, which is to say extreme poverty.

Rumilda, through the means of the clothing sales that she does, is fighting to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family members, so that they don't lack anything, and so that they have a respectable life. 

Rumilda is asking for this loan to purchase a greater quantity of clothing which will help her to establish her business plan, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of clothing.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, el  esfuerzo que están haciendo es continuo y permanente para así lograr un éxito total en sus vidas y en la de  sus  familias.
La Sra.  Graciela una de las integrantes, se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de confecciones que le piden sus clientes, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya tiene mucha clientela. Graciela es una persona muy sacrificada que se está esforzando para poder ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, con lo que podrá mejorar su vida y sus ingresos ya que podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
"Virgen de Fatima" is in its sixth cycle of the women's committee program, in which everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. Their efforts are continuous and permanent, in order to achieve complete success in their lives and in that of their families. 

Señora Graciela is one of the members. She works in sewing, making all types of garments requested by her customers. She is very good at what she does, so she already has a large clientele. 

Graciela is a very sacrificing woman who is working hard to be able to improve herself every day. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, and more; with this, she will be able to improve her life and her income because she will be able to continue with the work that she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, and more

loans.name: La Lomita Group

texts.es:
La Lomita se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, con la unión de vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad, todas ellas mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus seres queridos una mejor vida, es por ello que forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cynthia, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la costura que hace tiene los medios para poder procurarse una mejor vida para ella y para su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros, para poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
La Lomita was formed in the city of San Lorenzo, by neighbors and friends in this city who got together. All of them are female heads of household who want to give their loved ones a better life, so they are part of the poverty elimination program. 

One of the members is Cynthia who, through her efforts and continual work and through the sewing that she does, has the means to be able to get a better life for herself and her family. She is a very hard-working woman and very good at what she does. For this, she already has a very good customer base. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners, and more, to be able to continue with her sewing as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and more.

loans.name: La Cabañuela Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad con tradiciones de la cultura mazahua, se formó un grupo llamado “La Cabañuela” en honor al hogar de Don Alberto, construido completamente con madera. 

Él es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador, dedicado a su familia. Aunque actualmente ya sólo dos de sus seis hijos continúan estudiando, su trabajo en el campo y en la construcción de casas le ayudó a llevar el pan a casa, incluso a pesar de que nunca realmente le había gustado trabajar para otras personas. 

Hace años, Alberto emprendió su propio negocio abriendo una panadería, unos meses después, la falta de apoyo y capital lo orilló a cerrar. “Después conocí a VisionFund México y fue una gran esperanza para mí porque los préstamos tienen una muy buena tasa de interés”. Entonces comenzó a vender dulces, botanas y refrescos. Con base en esfuerzo y los siguientes préstamos, la pequeña mesa que Alberto instalaba para colocar los dulces se transformó en una tienda de abarrotes con gran variedad de productos. Hasta el día de hoy, sigue utilizando los créditos para comprar más mercancía como pan, huevo, leche y productos enlatados y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio.  

Hace poco, Alberto también invirtió en un molino que renta a las personas de su comunidad para ganar un poco de dinero extra cada que sus vecinos necesitan moler maíz. Ambas actividades van avanzando a pesar de la competencia, su principal reto, pero Alberto aún sueña con tener una panadería exitosa y dar empleo a otras personas. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidos con Kiva y VisionFund México por la oportunidad de invertir en sus negocios: Elisa invertirá en pollos; Rogelio, en una tienda de abarrotes; Valentina, en borregos y pollos y Néstor, en escobetas.

*En la imagen: los integrantes de pie frente al quiosco en el centro de su municipio, don Alberto viste una chamarra verde*
texts.en:
In a community with traditions from the Mazahua culture, a group formed called “La Cabañuela” in honor of Alberto's home which is made completely from wood. 

He is a responsible and hard-working father, dedicated to his family. Although only two of his six children currently are still in school, his work in the countryside and in building houses helped him to bring food to the house, despite never really liking to work for other people. 

Years ago, Albert undertook his own business, opening a bakery. A few months later, the lack of support and capital caused him to close it.
