"Then, I learned about VisionFund México and it was a great hope for me because the loans have a very good interest rate." Later, he began to sell sweets, snacks and soft drinks. With a base in hard work and the following loans, the little table that Alberto installed to hold his sweets became a grocery store with a great variety of products. To date, he continues using loans to purchase more merchandise such as bread, eggs, milk, and canned goods and to continue offering good service. 

A little while ago, Alberto also invested in a mill that he rents to people in his community to earn a bit of extra money each time his neighbors need to grind corn. Both activities are advancing despite the competition, his primary challenge, but Alberto still dreams of having a successful bakery and employing other people. 

The other members of the group are very grateful to Kiva and VisionFund México for the opportunity to invest in their businesses. Elisa will invest in chickens, Rogelio in a grocery store, Valentina in sheep and chickens, and Néstor in hand brooms.

*In the image: the members are standing in front of the kiosk at the center of their municipality. Alberto is wearing a green jacket.*

loans.use: to purchase bread, eggs, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is a rice retailer in her place. Agripina has also renovated her sari-sari store or variety store. 

Agripina wants to take a loan to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, bread and snack foods, among others. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Agripina has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, bread and snack foods, among others

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 24 years old. He is blessed with one child. He has had a horticulture business for three months, enjoying good profits. 

Ephantus has asked for a loan, which he will use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting. With the anticipated income, he will be able to repay his loan and in turn generate more income. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to pay school fees, buy a dairy cow, and provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old. She is married with four children. She does a farming business where she grows maize and beans and also rears livestock. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase animal feeds and add more goats and hopes this will help her build a poultry house and rear layers so that she can be a bulk supplier of eggs. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a great farmer, be stable financially and have a comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and add more goats

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide future financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Ruth has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Ruth also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Ruth's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 40-year-old married lady with three children. She lives in Fort Portal Uganda. She operates a business of tailoring school uniforms and, at the same time, sells bananas for extra income.

She is faced with challenges of limited capital alongside the unpredictable weather changes that hinder progress in her business. Besides that, she has hopes of starting a technical school in future. She has asked for a loan to buy materials and threads for sewing uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials and threads for sewing uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 46, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years she has been earning an income by raising pigs.

Mary Ann has taken out and successfully repaid a previous loan through NWTF. She is now applying for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Mary Ann’s goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is both a farmer and a bricklayer. He raises tea on his farm but is challenged by price fluctuations for it.

Joseph would like to finish building his house. He has asked for a 2,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy doors for and finish closing off his house.

loans.use: to buy doors for and finish closing off his house.

loans.name: Jeneta's Group

texts.en:
Jeneta's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Jeneta, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has four children. Jeneta has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Jeneta isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Jeneta will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jeneta's Group will purchase a total of 16 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is married and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He works as a farmer who grows tea and bananas and also runs a butcher shop that provides him with additional income. Vincent faces many challenges, including inadequate capital and unpredictable weather, that affect his business plans. His dream is to finish building his house so that his family has a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to complete work on his house.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 48 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a direct-sales business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as hand bags. Violeta has been in this business for nine years and her goal for the future is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan is 64 years old, a widowed mother with one grownup child, who lives in a community in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She earns some income from cultivating rice and she has been in this work for over 40 years. Her only child is working in a factory. Both Yan and her child can earn about $6 per day. Yan is lacking the money to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use. She will have enough finances to buy a motorcycle for her child with this loan. In the future, she wants to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn se dedica al alquiler de películas, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus gastos de tesis, y con ello poder terminar su carrera. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Hoy ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una computadora que le será de mucha utilidad.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de nuevo.
texts.en:
Evelyn works renting movies. She says that her previous loan was used to pay the costs of her thesis, and with it to finish her degree. She is a very hard-working and determined person. Today she is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase a computer which will be very useful for her.

She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting again.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anastacio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Anastacio De Jesús, Tiene 36 años de edad convive con su compañera de hogar es padre de tres hijos  su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, cuenta con más de 6 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad, El tiene una buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio don Anastacio está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado ya que con el crédito anterior fue de mucho provecho.
Don Anastacio está solicitando el crédito para la compra de más productos como frijoles, arroz, manteca, jabon, café, azúcar, pan, detergente, maíz y otros productos y así tener un muy buen surtido para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela,  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Anastacio su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darles una educación de calidad a sus hijos con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños y así sentir el apoyo que Prisma de Honduras y KIVA le estarían brindando.

                                                                            
                                                                                   Trojes, Honduras Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Anastacio De Jesús is 36 years old, lives with his partner and is the father of three children. His work is selling basic pantry supplies, he has done this work for more than 6 years. He has a good customer base since his business is located in a very strategic, very commercial location. Anastacio is very grateful for the support offered since with the previous loan he had a lot of benefit.

Anastacio is asking for the loan to purchase more products such as beans, rice, butter, soap, coffee, sugar, bread, detergent, corn and other products and in this way have a good assortment to satisfy his customers' demand, which will allow him to increase his income to cover the family expenses and his financial obligations.

Anastacio's dream is to improve his living conditions and give his children a quality education. The support he gets from the loan will contribute to achieving his dreams and he will feel the support that Prisma de Honduras and Kiva are offering him. 

                                                                            
                                                                                   Trojes, Honduras March 2015

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, butter, soap, coffee, sugar, bread, detergent, corn and other products for his business.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 37 years old and blessed with five children. For the past ten years he has been a small-scale farmer with a tree plantation that earns him approximately 12,000 KES a month.

Jeremiah has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES through Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and more trees to plant. The latter will help him meet the demands of his timber clients.

Jeremiah plans to use his profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hope is be a large-scale farmer in other agricultural sectors.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and more trees to plant on his timber plantation.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
From Ormoc City, Leyte, Norberto is 42, married and the father of three children. He has been raising pigs for several years now to earn an income.

Norberto is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy additional piglets and pig feed. This loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

Norberto hopes to save enough money for his children’s schooling and make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She has had a tailor shop  for 10 years and  used a previous loan to buy fabric  to make dresses. 

She will use this loan to purchase fabric and a sewing machine to make more dresses and increase her income.  She hopes this will help her open another tailoring shop.

 Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Meet Irine. She is a 49-year-old woman who has been a farmer for 10 years. She is based in Endebes village, where she has a one-acre farm and a small house made out of earth, with two habitable rooms. On the farm, she grows vegetables that she uses for both consumption and sale. This business has enabled her to raise three children. Irine's own upbringing was so difficult that she never had the privilege of attending school. She is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming.

With the loan, she will acquire a brood of hens that will lay eggs for food, sale and hatching. This business is projected to significantly increase her income. The birds will also bring life into her home, as they will be free-range and scratch the earth for bugs. The money from the investment will enable Irine to afford basic needs and save up for the future. This loan will go a long way towards empowering her to become a better entrepreneur and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is 28 years old and lives in the village Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. She is married, lives with her husband and mother-in-law, and enjoys farming, which she did before getting married. Tamar’s husband helps her care for their livestock, including cows, calves, pigs and sheep, and her mother-in-law makes cheese, which she sells from their house along with meat and milk. Tamar has a lot of regular customers and does not need to take her products to the city’s wholesale market in order to find buyers for them. She wants to sell more meat from her farm, and to make that possible has requested a Kiva loan to buy a calf and animal fodder for her herd.

loans.use: to buy a calf and also animal fodder for her livestock.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa familar con sus padres, vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de miel, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, realiza esta actividad desde hace 08 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de miel para implementar su negocio, con esto Sara espera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is 44 years old, lives in the family home with her parents, and lives in a community which works in trade, agriculture and animal husbandry which is located in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling honey, her business is located in her home. She has done this work for 8 years, having experience in the business and with very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be to purchase a greater quantity of honey to stock her business. With this, Sara hopes to offer a larger quantity of products to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income with the end of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of honey to stock her business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y tres hijos en el distrito de Pimpingos que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore resistente a enfermedades y plagas, tiene terreno agrícola propio donde cultiva el café, cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro porque anteriormente a cultivado otras variedades y ahora por cuestiones de plagas y enfermedades a renovado su plantación. Adicionalmente cultiva yuca, maiz y menestra para el comercio y para su propio consumo, y también cría animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, asegurando una buena producción lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old, lives with his spouse and three children in Pimpingos district, located in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this community is peaceful and the population works in agriculture and raising animals, primarily.

He works growing Catimore variety coffee, which is resistant to disease and pests. He has his own farmland where he grows the coffee. He has extensive experience in the field because before he had grown different varieties and now, because of pests and diseases, he has changed over his plantation. In addition, he grows yucca, corn, and pulses to sell and for his own consumption. He also raises small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and more. The loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop, assuring a good production which will be reflected in a greater volume of sales and in the end he will get more income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a cheerful, entrepreneurial, and courageous woman. She fights for her future with her own hands, and she does not expect anyone to give anything to her. 

She is from Siongiroi, Kenya, a community not known for farming, but she is earning a living through agriculture. For the past five years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from her fellow farmers, and she is regarded as a mentor. 

The income from milk, eggs, and maize selling have allowed her to earn a good income. To earn extra income, Betty engages in a small personal business. Betty passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding her cow makes her very proud. Through selling milk, she has seen very good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. 

Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers, and then sending text messages to her customers when milk is ready for collection, and because of using this, she has had a comparative edge in her dairy business. 

Demand has been overwhelming, and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand. Betty requested a loan, which she will use to buy a quality dairy cow. She wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich, creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income, and Betty will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. This loan will permanently change Betty’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice that she’ll resell to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a greater quantity of rice to retail and earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 50 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Christine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Christine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Christine's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 10.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Abiaz

texts.en:
Abiaz, aged 43 years, is widowed with seven children; all attend school at the moment. He is a cattle trader in his rural area of residence of Akayanja, Kitojo, whereby his clients are all categories of people. He started his business to be able to generate income for his family, working 10 hours a day. 

He has applied for a loan of 5 million shillings to buy fertilizer for his tea and coffee plants that will generate into high yields for trading. He hopes to buy a car in the future to ease the transportation of the products. He is faced with a challenge of limited working capital, but is ready to boost his business after getting a loan and will continue working hard to achieve his long-term dreams. He appreciates the good service of UGAFODE and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 31 and single. He has applied for a loan for UGX 2,000,000 to buy more items to sell in his retail business. He opened his store in 1999 with high hopes of earning income to look after his family. He also does tea farming to supplement his income. His business is located in Busy Street in the Butare T/C Bushenyi District and his customers are all types of people who live or work there. Andrew is a hardworking man who is in his store 11 hours a day, six days a week, but he faces challenges in the form of competition, high taxes and rental fees. He is determined to boost his business after getting this loan and achieve his long-term dreams of becoming financially stable and starting a wholesale company.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Jasoda, the lady standing first from the right, is 29 years old and engaged in the unique but profitable business of fish rearing, with special focus on Pohala and Rohu. The fishes grown in the pond and are then sold. Her loan amount of 12,000 INR will be used to buy additional fish fry for rearing and pay for the food, medicine and transportation costs. Her husband does paddy cultivation. Together, both of them are looking to enhance the family income and ensure her daughter continues to go to school.

Jasoda has made a group with two other women from her village and on behalf of her group, she is asking for a loan of 36,000 INR. The group is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy additional fish fry for rearing and pay for the food, medicine and transportation costs

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is a 24-year-old  single woman who is pursuing an associate’s degree in nursing.  She is in her second year at a university.

Sila is from the Pursat province in Cambodia. Her mother sells vegetables at a market and her grandmother grows rice. Sila is short of the finances to cover her university fees from the second to the third year; therefore she has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help her have enough funds to earn  an associate’s degree. 

For her future dreams, she is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary and save money to run her own business.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the second to the third year.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica sigue estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, ella está poniendo todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida e ir creciendo poco a poco. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con su carrera y luchar por sus sueños.
texts.en: Monica continues studying for her Accounting degree.  She is putting everything into it to improve her living conditions, and she is gradually growing.  She says that she used her previous loan to pay for her college fees, which was a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, vino desde el interior del país para poder estudiar e ir progresando cada día.
Él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino y ser alguien en la vida para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mauro is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He came from the inside of the country to be able to study and continue progressing each day.

He is studying the field of accounting. Through his studies, he wants to be able to open a path for himself and become someone in life to be able to help other people.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay his school fees and, with this, to be able to continue studying. He is thankful for the opportunity that he receives to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es de la ciudad de Villarrica, él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ir abriéndose camino para poder ser un gran profesional.
Sergio pone su mejor esfuerzo para ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello estar cerca de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Sergio is from the city of Villarrica. He is studying the field of accounting, and through his studies, he wants to be able to open a path for himself so that he can because a great professional.

Sergio puts his best effort into becoming someone in his life and helping his family.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay his school fees, and, with this, to be closer to achieving his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz viene de una familia trabajadora, quien la ayuda es su madre quien es comerciante y la apoya en todo.
Luz está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las personas en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Se está esforzando bastante en poder ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que se está esforzando mucho, pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir  luchando por sus metas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Luz comes from a hard-working family. Her mother, who is a businesswoman, helps her and supports her in everything.

Luz is studying the field of nursing, and through this career, she wants to be able to help people with their health, which is important. She is making a major effort in becoming someone in her life. It is for this reason that she is working so hard.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her school fees, and, with this, to be able to continue fighting for her goals as they come.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El Comité Rosa Mistica, es un grupo que trabaja hace 2 años en la fundación paraguaya. Tienen muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos y ayudar a sus familias.
Ada es integrante de este grupo, ella vende perfumes varios, tiene muchos clientes y clientas que compran de ella las variedades que siempre trae. Se define a sí misma como una persona que quiere crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar perfumes varios, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, ya que con ello puede ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Committe Rosa Mistica is a group that has been working for two years with Fundación Paraguaya. They have high expectations to be able to invest to generate more income and help their families.

Ada is a member of this group.  She sells various perfumes and has many customers who buy the varieties she carries. She defines herself as a person who wants to grow and be someone in life. She is asking for this loan so she can buy a variety of perfumes and continue with her perfume sales as she has been doing, so she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted perfumes for sale.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza  se formó en la ciudad de Luque, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Verónica ella  es cliente de la Fundación,  tiene una mesita en el circuito comercial donde vende ropas,  tiene varias operaciones canceladas de la mejor manera. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group “La Esperanza” (“The Hope”) was formed in the city of Luque. They are female heads of households, who take part in a Fundación Paraguaya program that aims to eliminate poverty.

One of the members is Mrs. Verónica. She is a client of the Fundación. She has a small stand in the commercial area, where she sells clothing. She has had many loans repaid in a good way. She is a very hard-working woman and, above all, is selfless.

She asks for this loan to buy various types of garments to be able to continue with her sales as they have been going. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives, since it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy various types of garments to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, está esforzándose por poder ser alguien en la vida.
Es empleada y está cursando el último año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables, comenta que durante toda la carrera ha puesto todo de si para poder sobresalir siempre.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas pendientes de su carrera y poder terminar con ello sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe
texts.en: Aurelia is from the city of Curuguaty.  She is studying and working at the same time, and she is pushing herself to be someone in life.  She is employed, and in her last year of study for an accounting degree.  She says that she has put everything into her studies all during her degree program so that she will always excel.  She is requesting this loan to pay outstanding fees, and be able to complete her studies.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a 40-year-old married woman withf three children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living by raising hogs. Eleanor has been in the business for  5 years. This is the source of her income. 

Eleonor requests a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. A loan will be used to improve her business and income.

loans.use: to buy  piglets  and animal feed.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Kuera Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Joaju Kuera; está en su ciclo número    4  del programa de comité de mujeres, son 23 mujeres que se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien está en pareja y tiene 2 hijos;  quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella es miembro excelente del comité. El trabajo que ella realiza es decoraciones y adornos para fiestas de cumpleaños y otras fechas especiales.
Utilizará este préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo isopor, cintas, pegamentos y variados diseños de adornos que ella utiliza.
texts.en:
The group is called “Kuña Joaju Kuera.” It is in its fourth cycle with the program for groups of women. They are 23 women who meet to be able to help each other improve their conditions of their lives.

One of the members is Mrs. Liz, who is in a relationship and has 2 children. In her last survey, her level of poverty was a level 3, which means that she has been improving her financial situation. She is an excellent member of the group. 

Her work is doing decorations and ornaments for birthday parties and other special days. 

She will use this loan to buy materials, such as Styrofoam, ribbons, glue, and various designs of decorations that she uses.

loans.use: to buy Styrofoam, ribbons, glue, and various designs of decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his monograph to finish his degree.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a 55-year-old married woman with two grown children from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

She runs a small sari-sari store to sell various goods and items to the people in her area. Isabelita requests a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. 

A loan will help her to improve her stock and attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, rice, soda,  beverages, soap,  toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all  attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for two years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She is challenged by the changing seasons.

She will use the 25,000 KES loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase  sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a 41-year-old lady living in Fort Portal Uganda. She sells second hand clothes and  grows bananas to earn an income. She is challenged by inadequate capital and high license fees. 

She sees herself as the owner of a fully stocked boutique of second hand clothes. She has asked for a loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is 20 years old. He lives with his parents in Kutaisi district. Anzor is unemployed and decided to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 250 USD to purchase a camera  to start his own business. 

Anzor is an experienced photographer and he thinks that the business will be profitable. He will take orders for weddings and different kinds of parties and will generate his own income.

loans.use: to purchase a camera.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 74 years old and lives with his beloved wife in Sevan City of Gegharkunik region. Yurik has higher education and specialty of coach-pedagogue. He is proud to mention that he started from 1967 and still works today because of his specialty; he is an athletic trainer. He leads a healthy lifestyle and thanks to that despite of his age he feels healthy and strong. The same unfortunately he cannot say about his wife.

His wife has some health problems which lately cause great discomfort to her everyday life and Yurik greatly hopes that with this Kiva loan amount he can solve his wife’s health problem.

loans.use: pay for his wife's health problem.

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.es:
La Sra. Perseveranda tiene 77 años, es viuda desde hace 3 años, estuvo casada por 48 años, ella tiene un lavadero en el cual trabaja y se esfuerza mucho, y con lo cual ayudó a sus hijos.
La señora Perseveranda tiene su negocio de lavadero desde hace 4 años, lleva adelante gracias a la ayuda de sus dos hijos que vive con ella.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de detergentes, soda caustica y otros insumos utilizados en su negocio, que le permitirá contar con esos materiales para poder realizar su trabajo sin inconvenientes y así disponer de un ingreso permanente.-
texts.en:
Sra. Perseveranda is 77 years old and has been widowed for three years. She had been married for 48 years. Perseveranda has a laundry business where she works with great effort. As a result, she has been able to help her children.

Sra. Perseveranda has been in the laundry business for four years. She has been able to get ahead with the help of her two children who live with her.

Perseveranda is requesting a loan in order to buy detergents, caustic soda, and other supplies that are used in her business. As a result, she will have the materials that she needs to do her work without problems and be able to generate a permanent income.

loans.use: to buy detergents, caustic soda, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es:
Yanira esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, esta luchando y esforzándose para poder ser alguien en la vida e ir abriéndose en el mercado laboral, y con ello poder mejorar su vida y ayudar  a su familia. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en cubrir sus gastos de la universidad que le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Yanira is pursuing a degree in Accounting. She is working hard and making every effort to make something of herself and break into the job market, so she can improve her life and help out her family.

She says that she used her previous loan to cover her university expenses, which was very useful.

Now, she is requesting this loan to pay her university tuition fees and keep on studying.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Luis está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres. Se trabajó con las señoras mediante capacitaciones donde todas participaron con mucho entusiasmo por aprender, también mediante los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa lograron aumentar sus ingresos y superar la línea de pobreza, mediante el programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maricel quien tiene una despensa, que ella comenta pudo montar con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo y con la ayudar de su grupo ha ido aprendiendo como administrarla y poder mejorar. Quiere ir creciendo poco a poco y es por ello que pone todo de sí y siempre tiene mucho entusiasmo para todo.
La Sra. Maricel solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los productos de necesidades básicas para surtir su negocio,  como por ejemplo: leche, azúcar, aceite, harina, entre otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group “San Luis” is in its third cycle with the program for groups of woman. The women—through trainings, in which all participated with a lot of enthusiasm to learn and through lessons on vital behaviors of a successful woman—succeeded in increasing their income and overcoming poverty, through the program to eliminate poverty.  

One of the members is Mrs. Maricel, who has a store, which she says she was able to start with a lot of sacrifice and effort. With the help of her group, she has learned how to manage it and how to improve. She wants to continue growing little by little, and it is for this reason that she puts all of herself into her work and always has a lot of enthusiasm for everything.

Mrs. Maricel requests this loan to buy the basic products she needs to supply her business. These include milk, sugar, oil, and flour, among other things. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy basic product she needs to supply her store, including milk, sugar, oil, and flour, among other things.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina está casada, es dueña de una Despensa, que está ubicada en su local propio, comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los variados productos que ofrece.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano en el día, y quiere poder ir creciendo y mejorando cada día para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena atención, y también para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de carne, verduras, frutas, panificados, leche y otros, de manera a poder estar siempre bien surtida para sus clientes.
texts.en: Catalina is married, and owns a general store, located in her own space.  She says that she already has many customers that always buy the varied products she sells.  She is a very hardworking person, and starts work very early every day.  She wants to grow and improve each day so that she can offer her customers good service, and also be able to support her family.  She is requesting this loan to purchase meat, vegetables, fruit, baked goods, milk, and other items.  This will enable her to always be well-stocked for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, fruit, baked goods, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte.

Jessica has run a shirt printing business for more than 19 years now. She also operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Jessica is asking to take a loan to buy more materials for printing, like a brush, screen nets and paints, and to buy groceries to sell, like noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and others. A loan will help her improve her businesses as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for printing, like a brush, screen nets and paints, and to buy groceries to sell, like noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is a 45-years-old married man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small, simple house. Nayef works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is his family's only source of income. Nayef  would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Nayef took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity.

Nayef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 37 years old and supports a family of three people. He is married to one wife and his children are all in school. His wife is a housewife. 

Silas has operated an agrovet business for the last six years and has managed to provide well for his family through it. 

He is taking this loan to buy more agrovet products to stock his shop. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future include being financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more agrovet products to stock his shop

loans.name: Varuzhan

texts.en:
Varuzhan lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. He is married and he has two daughters (both of them are married already) and a son. Varuzhan’s son and wife are unemployed and he is the only bread-winner in his family.

Varuzhan offers car repairing services in his own garage. He also has small plot of land on which he organizes vegetable and fruit cultivation. With the help of his son, Varuzhan sells his harvest at the city wholesale market and some part of it he also keeps for his family's use.

Now Varuzhan has some health problems which he must solve as it greatly worries him. Varuzhan plans to arrive to Yerevan city and use this Kiva loan for medical examination.

loans.use: to pay for medical examinations.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 56 years old and has 6 children. 

Flora works hard despite a thyroid illness tand taking care of her special child while managing her grocery store business. Though most of her children are grown up, they have their own families and are unable to help her with expenses. Her husband is a painter and  helps her to sell  hot dogs, sausages and sweetened pork in his workplace to make ends meet.

Her first loan was 10, 000 PHP and was used as additional capital for her grocery store and frozen goods business.  It  increased their income and helped them to meet expenses.

Flora requests 20,000 PHP to buy 3 boxes of canned goods, 2 cases of soft drinks, 30 sachets of powdered laundry soap, shampoo, and other items.

Flora hopes to expand her sari-sari store and start a rice business someday. She also wanted to start  a mineral water business to help support their needs and save for their health.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of canned goods, 2 cases of soft drinks, 30 sachets of powdered laundry soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Winners Group

texts.en:
These six women are part of a group called Winners. The ladies are focused on transforming their lives through empowerment, small loans, and education. They have a vision to raise their standard of living and create a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are material, lining, frozen food, general goods, cosmetics, and groundnuts. 

Elizabeth is married, has two children, and is a member of the Winners. Elizabeth is a 34-year-old trader who has sold cosmetics for 3 years. Elizabeth wants to continue to support her children  with their studies through the university level. 

Elizabeth has a cosmetics business and buys the cosmetics at wholesale prices and sells to customers. She and other members have made tremendous improvements in their businesses. The majority of the ladies do not know how to read or write and so the training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family members and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in their indigenous language, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem. The seven women look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: to buy the cosmetics.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a young woman, 39 years old. She is happy, hardworking, honest, vigorous, and the mother of three adorable children. Lilian is a woman who puts her heart and soul into her mixed farm and her family.

Lilian owns a two-acre farm where she practices mixed farming. She keeps dairy animals and grows maize, bananas and vegetables. She has fifteen years of experience in farming. Lilian is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm.

She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Lilian.

Through a group of 15 members called Kaibu, Lilian has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled.

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Lilian because the institution believes that women too can be actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. With her already 35 years of pedagogical experience, she works with the same devotion and enthusiasm, as she started many years ago when she was a young girl. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature.

She also gives paid private courses of this subject at her house as a way of preparing the pupils for the entrance exams to higher institutions. Sonya is 62 years old and she mentions it is never late to learn and to become aware of the things that belong to newer generation.

With this loan amount she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature; she will use these to make her private lessons more inserting and she herself will receive a lot of new information connected with the methodology of teaching and changes in it.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.name: Yingping

texts.en:
Yingping is a 44-year-old man who lives with his parents and a son who attends high-school. He and his wife have raised pigs for many years.

The cost of raising pigs are increasing and his parents are getting older and cannot earn a living. His son’s education fee is increasing. Yiping and his wife wish to rebuild their house to improve their environment and living standards. Yingping requests 5,000 CNY from MicroCred to rebuild his house to provide better  living conditions for his parents to enjoy their old age. He hopes that he and his wife could provide a better life for their family.

loans.use: to rebuild his house .

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a 25-years-old single man from Gaza City. he lives with his family in a small, simple house. Muhannad works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Muhannad would like to improve the family's  living conditions and buy all the necessary items.

Muhannad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water. This will provide the family with hot water without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to heat water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new camera instead of the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials like wheat and sugar for his business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 35 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. He is in the motorcycle transport business which he has done for the past 10 years.

Gabriel has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to buy another motorcycle.

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to grow his business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. 

Estrella has been in the business for more than five years now. Estrella is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments among others. A loan will help her improve her stocks which will attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments among others

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is 32 years old and  lives with his wife and two pretty daughters in Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. 

Hayk works at a private company and also  farms because  it is good way to earn a living and have healthy, fresh products for his young family. Hayk has farm has 2 cows, 3 calves, 3 pigs, 2 heifers, 15 sheep and 50 chickens. His products  include milk, meat and eggs and his wife is a skillful manager. This family is happy  farming and they dream of making it bigger.

Hayk will use the loan to buy a calf and  fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Adom Nti Group

texts.en:
This 3-member group is in its seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The members run a variety of business including selling ice cream, socks, and meat. 

They will use the loan to benefit their businesses. Rebecca (pictured in the middle) joined ID-Ghana long ago, through a promotional campaign by the institution. She began her meat selling business 19 years ago with  basic capital. She expanded her business over time. 

She will use a new loan  to buy meat to sell to customers. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has one child who is at the university. She  likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy  meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is an iSmart sales superstar! She began working as a sales agent for iSmart and is now selling clean-burning cookstoves and other products in informal settlements in Nairobi.

Christine's loan will help her bring green and clean-energy products to low-income families living in Nairobi's slums. The cookstoves she sells reduce fuel consumption by half, saving her customers money and also saving trees.

loans.use: to pay for green energy products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn is a 39-year-old hardworking entrepreneur with 3 children.

She has a mobile snack vending business that operates from 9 am to 3 pm. She sells quail eggs and fish balls.  She earns 150-200 PHP daily and helps with  daily expenses. 

Maylyn has used previous loans to grow her business and she bought a customized cart which enables her to travel around the community, carry bottles for sauces, acquire new cooking equipment, and add various new products (hot dogs and fruit drinks) for her customers.  She has  increased her net income to 300-400 PHP daily.

Maylyn requests another loan of 24,000 PHP to buy 100 quail eggs, 3 bags of ground pork with vegetables, 3 bags of dumplings, and 2 bags of chocolate and fruit flavored powder to sell in her snack vending business.

Maylyn wanted to expand her business in the future to help with expenses and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy  quail eggs,  ground pork with vegetables,  dumplings, and chocolate and fruit flavored powder.

loans.name: Nawodi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Nawodi a soldé son premier prêt avec kiva et a renouvelé son contrat. A l'aide de son prêt, Salimata avait pu faire son commerce de bouilli et son bénéfice a servi à s'occuper de sa famille. Elle remercie kiva pour son soutien et espère qu'elle aura un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. La bouilli est consommé par beaucoup de famille surtout les matins au Burkina. Salimata fait une activité qui est rentable et qui peut lui permettre d'aider son époux dans la gestion quotidienne de leur famille. Avec son commerce, cette brave dame arrive à faire ses propres dépenses( habillements chaussures, coiffure, etc).A l'issue de ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui permettra de renforcer son activité.
texts.en: The group Nawodi has completed its first loan with Kiva and has renewed its contract. With the help of her loan, Salimata was able to have a business selling porridge, and her profit was used to take care of her family. She thanks Kiva for its support and hopes that she will have a new loan in order to continue her work. The porridge is consumed by many families, especially in the morning in Burkina. Salimata has a business which is profitable and which enables her to help out her family. With her business, this good and honest lady manages to support herself (clothing, shoes, hair, etc.) After she makes her sales, she will have a profit for bolstering her business.

loans.use: to purchase millet, ginger, tamarind, and other ingredients for making porridge to sell

loans.name: Wend-Yayé 01 Group

texts.fr: Asseta est le membre représentatif de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés. Cette brave fait la restauration et cela depuis 10 ans. Son menue est composé de Tô, un plat beaucoup apprécier au Burkina, du riz avec des sauces variés et du riz au gras. Asseta a besoin  de ce crédit pour acheter du riz, de la farine de maïs, de la viande et des condiments pour préparer et vendre. Son bénéfice lui permettra d'augmenter le volume de son activité et de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Asseta is the representative member of this group. She is a married mother of four children, of whom three are in school. This good and honest woman has been in the restaurant business for ten years. Her menu is compose of Tô, a dish that is much appreciated in Burkina. It includes rice served with various sauce and fatty rice. Asseta has need of this loan to purchase some rice, cornmeal, meat, and condiments to make and sell. Her profit will enable her to increase her business volume and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cornmeal, and condiments to cook and sell

loans.name: Famille Bivundu Group

texts.fr: "Parmi les cultures de notre milieu, j'avais constaté que celle du café est plus rentable et durable que les autres. Voilà pourquoi j'ai pris la décision de devenir caféiculteur", telles sont les déclarations de Modeste. Souvent, il est incapable d'entretenir seul son café vu l'étendue en sa possession raison pour laquelle il sollicite ce crédit. Il souhaiterait rajeunir ses tiges afin d'améliorer sa production pour le bien-être de sa famille. Son épouse l'accompagne sur la photo.
texts.en:
“Of the crops found in our environment, I have noticed that coffee is more profitable and durable than the others. This is why I made the decision to become a coffee grower,” says Modeste. 

He is asking for a loan as he is unable to take care of his coffee plantation on his own—given the area of the land that he owns. He would like to cut back his plants in order to improve his crop. This will help his family's well being. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: with upkeep and harvesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply eggs to his customers and meet their demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for her business to help her pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 27 years old. He is married with 1 child.

He has had a bicycle transport business for 2 years now and it has been profitable. Jackson will be using the loan to purchase another bicycle and hopes this will help him make more income and be able to support his family. He will also use the income to open up a retail shop.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in his business and prosper.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle for his transportation business and make more income to support his family

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 45 years old and from Western Kenya. He is married to Monica, a business lady who provides additional income to the family. They support three people in their family including two children who are five and two years respectively.

Paul, who has been selling cereals as well as posho-mill (grain milling machine) services for the last six years, has requested his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional sacks of maize and beans for resale. Both enterprises have earned him a monthly income of 7,000 KES.

He will reinvest the anticipated profit in the business. Paul's dream is to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his aluminum workshop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 26-year-old married woman with four children. Her previous loan was profitable and she has been able to expand her business and opened a retail shop and a butcher business. 

She has been in business for eight years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She will use the loan to purchase  cooking oil, detergent, soft drinks, and flour.  She  hopes to open another retail shop. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business  and open another butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy  meat for  her butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk and earn more income

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 35 years old and is blessed with 5 children. She has been a small-scale farmer for the last 6 years and the business earns her 9,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her to add more milk supplies to sell to her customers and meet their demands. 

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of education. Her future hope is be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to add more milk supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver lives with his mother in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. He is a 43-year-old man trained as an engineer.  He worked for many years an an engineer, but now he is a farmer.  He manages to earn a living for the family. 

He occasionally works constructional  but his farm is his first priority. He has 3 cows, 2 bulls, a calf, 15 sheep, and 15 chickens. Nver’s mother is a health, 84-year-old woman who help her son with the  farm by  selling  milk, meat, cheese, and eggs. Nver is a very hard working man and  has a new plan in which he greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

He will use 700.000 AMD to purchase a tractor to transfer cargo and work the farm.

loans.use: to purchase  a tractor for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 38 years old. She studied at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the department of Chemistry and Ecology. Already 10 years on, she works at the city school as a teacher of chemistry.

Kristine mentions that chemistry is one of the hardest for most pupils. She does her best to help them concentrate and to become interested in a subject through performing chemical experiments connected with the theme of the lesson at the school laboratory.

She also tries to make the private course she offers at her flat interesting and informative as she helps a group of pupils to get prepared for their entrance exams. Kristine is married and she lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region with her husband and her pretty twin daughters.

Kristine will be happy to receive this loan as she wants to buy a computer and professional literature in order to have fresh, interesting information connected with her subject.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan lives with his family in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Vahan is a very skillful and careful driver, and he works at many different organizations as a driver. Simultaneously, he is a perfect farmer.

He established his farm little by little, with great hardships. Now it is not a big one, but it brings good income and provides fresh products for his small family.

Vahan has a son who unfortunately has health problems so he needs great care and attention every day. Vahan does his best to provide his family with good living conditions.

On his farm, Vahan has a cow, heifers, pigs and chickens. On his plot of land, Vahan mainly cultivates potato, greens, tomato and cucumber. He sells all of his farm products at the wholesale market, mainly to re-sellers.

Vahan is a little bit worried since because of the lack of money, he still hasn't managed to get prepared for spring sowing activities. He needs urgent support.

He greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with the requested loan amount, with which he wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for agricultural activities and also some fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for agricultural activities and also some fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Bogologo De Balole Group

texts.fr:
Mme  ADAMA  est responsable du groupe BOGOLOGO DE BALOLE. Elle  est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 07ans.  03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 12  personnes en charge.
Mme est restauratrice depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le  marché  de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz, 01 bidon d’huile et du bois.
Elle   veut utiliser les  bénéfices du prêt pour aider son mari à nourrir ses enfants et payer leur scolarité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande grossiste et améliorer sa restauration.
texts.en:
Ms. ADAMA is the official of the group BOGOLOGO DE BALOLE. She is a married mother of five children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 7. Three children go to school. She has twelve persons to support. 

Ms. ADAMA has been a restauranteur for four years. She gets her supplies at a market in her district. With the granted loan, she intends to purchase 3 sacks of rice, a container of oil, and some firewood. She wants to use the profits from the loan to help her husband to feed her children and to pay for their schooling. Her ambition is to become a major wholesaler and to improve her food service.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and firewood for her restaurant

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación básica, vive junto a su esposo, sus 3 hijos y un nieto.

Adela, desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a la comercialización de mariscos.

Ahora ella, está solicitando un crédito para hacer la división de un cuarto para uno de sus hijos, porque ya está casado y con el dinero del crédito comprará cemento, arena, y bloques para hacerlo.

Adela, desea poder realizar esas mejoras en su vivienda, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hijo para que no tenga que irse a vivir lejos.
texts.en:
Adela, age 44, studied through the third grade.  She lives with her husband, her three children, and one grandchild.

For many years now, Adela has worked selling seafood.

Now she is asking for a loan to make a dividing wall in a room for one of her sons, because he is married.  With the money from the loan she will buy cement, sand, and cinderblocks for building it.

Adela wants to be able to make these improvements in her home in order to improve her son’s living conditions so that he doesn’t have to leave and live far away.

loans.use: to build a wall in a room for one of her children, because he is married.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different phone recharge cards to sell to customers.

loans.name: Famille Baba Tazama Group

texts.fr: Dieudonné a commencé la culture du café il y a 40 ans, à l'époque où il a abandonné ses études faute de moyens pour s'adonner au café dans le champ qu'il a reçu de ses parents. Compte tenu du fait qu'il est souvent bloqué par le manque d'argent pour payer la main d'oeuvre pour différents travaux, il estime que cette fois-ci ce crédit lui permettra de le faire sans problème. Il souhaite diversifier ses activités et ainsi détenir différentes sources de revenus. Il est accompagné de son épouse sur la photo.
texts.en:
Dieudonné starting growing coffee 40 years ago. At that time, he had to stop going to school since he did not have enough money. He gave himself over to growing coffee in the field he received from his parents.

Realizing that he often lacks to funds to pay for labor for various tasks, he hopes that the loan will allow him to do so with no issues. He would like to diversify his business activities and therefore, his revenue sources. He is pictured with his spouse in the photo.

loans.use: pay for labor for upkeep and harvesting.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy relaxers, treatments, shampoo, braids, and weaves. 

Her major challenge includes power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy relaxers, treatments, shampoo, braids, and weaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit and condiments for making breakfasts, which she sells; and some jewelry and shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, clutch bags, and handbags to resell

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholas is 37 years old. He is married with two children. He used his previous loan to purchase tools for his business which was more profitable, and thus he grew to a garage.

He has had a motorcycle/bicycle repair business for 11 years. He will be using the loan to purchase purchase  spare parts for use in repairing motorcycles and  bicycles and this will help him support his school children and improve his day to day life style.

This is his fifth loan term with Vision Fund Kenya and he has successfully paid his previous loans His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow well in his business and in standard life.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for use in repairing motorcycles and  bicycles

loans.name: Crezil

texts.en:
Crezil is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte.

Crezil runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods to the people in the neighborhood. Crezil is asking to take a loan to buy stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies and bread. A loan will help her improve inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Crezil hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stock such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies and bread to sell.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet lives in a nice village, Ddmashen, of the Gegharkunik region. He has vocational education; he graduated constructional college and graduated it with perfect knowledge of techniques of construction. Since his very young age till today, he works in this field and he is known as a very acute and skilled master. 

Nevertheless farming is the most important for Hamlet and his family, since through that his family has a great range of farm products always fresh and tasty, and he also earns good income from their sale. Hamlet’s farm is not very big but anyway it needs daily care as well. In his farm he has cows, a calf, sheep, and a lot of chickens. 

Hamlet’s pretty wife (they have a son and a daughter) greatly helps her husband on the farm, especially with sale of dairy-products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), and cheese, and also with the sale of meat and eggs. Land cultivation is also part of Hamlet’s daily work about his farm; he grows and sells his land’s potatoes, carrots, and greens.

Hamlet asks for this Kiva loan because his farm animals lack fodder and he decided to solve this problem by the help of Kiva lenders since still the pastures are not full of grass. He will buy fodder for his all farm animals.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his all farm animals

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg-1B Group

texts.en:
Rinku, the woman standing first from the right, 34, lives in the Sagada village of Sonepur district, Odisha with her husband and two children. She has studied up to Class 7, but she wants both her children to complete their education and have a much better future. She has managed to get her son to do a Bachelor's degree. Her husband is a daily wage earner and she has been running a grocery store for the last five years to manage the household expenses. 

Rinku is looking for a loan of 12,000 INR to expand her business. She wants to add more items like rice, oils, and pulses, and increase the quantity of her current items. Slowly but steadily, Rinku has been strengthening her business and her children's future prospects. Please come forward to help her with this next step!

Rinku, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy rice, different sorts of oil, and pulses (lentils) in bulk, and increase the quantity of her current items.

loans.use: to buy rice, different sorts of oil, and pulses (lentils) in bulk, and increase the quantity of her current items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg-1A Group

texts.en:
Bhagyabati, the woman from Sonepur, Odisha, who is standing in the middle in the photo, has been operating her business of ready-made dresses and saris for the past six years. After she managed to repay her earlier loan for the same business, she felt encouraged to expand her business further with a second loan request for 12,000 INR. Her plan includes purchasing additional material from the main market, providing value-addition by stitching/sewing and then selling these back in the market.

Bhagyabati, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy material for dresses in bulk to resell. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy additional material from the main market, provide value-addition by stitching/sewing, and then sell back in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paints and tools for his new business.

loans.name: Bridgid

texts.en:
Brigid is 49 years old. She is married and together with her spouse has been blessed with five children. She has had an agriculture business for seven  years earning a monthly income of KES 80,000.

Brigid has requested a loan  with VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help her to improve her farming methods so as to increase her income. This is Brigid's fifth loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan.  

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow big In her business and ensure that her children get good educations.

loans.use: To purchase farrm inputs so as to increase her income

loans.name: Eurika Jim

texts.en:
Eurika Jim is a 34-year-old married man and a father of a one-year-old son from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Eurika Jim is engaged in the food vending business, selling home cooked bread in his place. Eurika Jim has been in the business for more than three years now. This is his source of income.  

Eurika Jim would like to take a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, baking soda, cooking oil, and a cooking pan. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, baking soda, cooking oil, and a cooking pan

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 57-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in the  hog raising business.  This is her source of income. 

Elena is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them. This loan will help Elena in improving her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 33 years old and is blessed with three children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last eight years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

Jackline has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her to add more milk supply for her customers and meet their demand. She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of education. 

Her future hope is be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to add more milk supply

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik has a higher pedagogical education as she graduated the Pedagogical State Institute, the faculty of Physics and Mathematics.  For already 10 years she has worked in this field; she is a teacher of mathematics at the local school. She says that she is happy with choice of her profession and now she works with great pleasure and care with the children of different ages. 

She also has group of pupils whom she helps to get prepared for entrance examinations, giving them private courses of mathematics. Asghik is married and she has a son (he is passing his military service at the army) and a daughter (she is already married). Astghik’s husband regularly goes to work abroad. She lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. 

This loan of  250,000 AMD (Armenian drams) she requests as she wants to buy a computer and some literature connected with her profession. She thinks that through these purchases she can develop her pedagogical knowledge and get aware of innovations in this field.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature connected with her profession

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Ariga

texts.en:
