Together with her big family, Ariga lives in the village Geghamavan of Gegharkunik region. Ariga lives with her husband, three sons and her father-in-law. During the year, her husband and elder son regularly to the Russian Federation to look for work. So, Ariga spends the greater part of the year with her two sons and father-in-law. She is busy in her farm all day long, taking care of her cows, calves, heifers, sheep, a bull, a pig and chickens. As she says, she does not manage to feel how day ends since she has to take care of her house, her big farm, and organize the sale of her farm produce (milk, meat, cheese and eggs). 

Ariga is a very clever woman and does everything about her farm very skillfully and with pleasure. This woman is requesting this Kiva loan as her farm livestock have a lack of fodder; with this loan amount she will buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm livestock.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for her livestock

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Wendsongda De Weglega Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SALIF  est responsable du groupe WENDSONGDA DE WEGLEGA.  Il  est marié sans enfant avec  01  personne en charge.
Mr est gérant de kiosque depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les  marchés  environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 caisses  de boissons (sucrerie)  et 02 boites de café.
Il   veut utiliser les  bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille et payer la scolarité de son petit frère. Il ambitionne devenir un grand  commerçant pour ouvrir d’autres kiosques  dans d’autres villages.
texts.en: Mr. SALIF is the official of the group WENDSONGDA DE WEGLEGA. He is a married and has no children. He has one person to support. Mr. SALIF has been the manager of a kiosk or eatery for three years. He gets his supplies from surrounding markets. With the granted loan, he intends to purchase 3 cases of soft drinks and 2 cans of coffee. He wants to use the profits from the loan to help his family and to pay for his little brother’s education. His ambition is to become a major merchant in order to open other eateries in other villages.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and coffee for his eaterie

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit, with her husband and pretty daughter, lives in the village Varser of the Gegharkunik region. Anahit worked for many years as a tailor, but after the collapse of Soviet Union she lost her job. So she and her husband established a farm which, to this day, brings them income and covers their everyday needs. 

Anahit’s husband works as a welder and he also has enough time to help his wife about their farm. In her farm Anahit has cows, calves, a bull, a heifer, a pig, sheep, lambs and a lot of chickens. She mentions all these with great pride as such a rich farm is the result of her and her husband’s hard and proper work of many years. From her farm she sells good range of products; milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, eggs and also great assortment of meat such as beef, mutton, pork and poultry. She says that each product has its regular customer and nothing from her farm products manages to get spoiled as it is quickly sold. Anahit also has a plot of land on which, with the help of her husband, cultivates potato, tomato, cucumber, greens and pepper; half of which is for sale and the other part they use for their family. 

This loan Anahit asks for is to buy potato seedlings and quickly start her spring sowing activities. She also wants to buy some animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and quickly start her spring sowing activities, and to buy some animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Adom Nti 2 Group

texts.en:
From Chorkor, six members are part of a group called Adom Nti 2. The members are focused on transforming their lives through empowerment, small loans, and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are selling ice cream, second hand clothing, herbal medicine,  underwear, and lining. 

Vivian is single and is a member of this group. She is a 51-year-old trader who has sold herbal medicine for six years. Vivian wants to continue to work hard so that she can maintain and improve her business. Vivian sells her merchandise at retail. She buys herbal medicine at the wholesale price from the manufacturers and sells to customers. She has been trained to determine which medicine can be best for a particular sickness. 

She has made a tremendous improvement in her business, as have the other members. The majority of the women do not know how to read or write. The training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the members, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem. The six members look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicine at the wholesale price from the manufacturers and sell to customers.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es un padre de familia de cincuenta y tres años de edad, es casado, este humilde hombre está muy agradecido  por el crédito anterior porque  gracias a ello el logro comprar sus herramientas de albañil y logro mejorar los ingresos para construirles una casa a su familia por lo que su  familia ya cuenta con un hogar más seguro, Miguel a pesar de todo su esfuerzo por tener la casa terminada no lo ha conseguido por lo que ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder construir unas gradas que su casa necesita  comprando sus materiales como, cemento, hierro, arena y piedrín. Miguel tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para terminar la su casa antes de finalizar este año.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 53-year-old parent; he is married.  This humble man is very grateful for the previous loan because thanks to it he managed to buy his construction tools and improve his income in order to build a house for his family.  Because of that, his family now has a safer home.  

In spite of all his efforts to finish up the house, Miguel hasn’t quite managed it, so now he is asking for a new loan to be able to build some stairs that his house needs.  He will be buying materials such as cement, rebar, sand, and gravel.  Miguel has hopes of getting this new loan in order to finish the house before the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, sand, and gravel to build stairs in his home.

loans.name: Famille Urbain Group

texts.fr: Pour Urbain, l'activité du café est la principale source de revenu de Munyiidjwi, voilà pourquoi à travers la petite portion de terre reçue de son père, il y a planté des caféieirs. Les maladies de plantes et les débouchés incertains freinent cette activité mais cela n'empêche à Urbain de rêver grand quant à l'élargissement de sa plantation, améliorer ses conditions alimentaires, son habitat et surtout scolarisation les enfants à sa charge. Ils se sont constitués en équipe avec sa soeur Pascaline (voir photo).
texts.en: Urbain’s coffee business is for him the main source of income in Munyiidjwi. That is why he planted coffee trees on the small bit of land he got from his father. Plant diseases and uncertain market outlets will slow down this business but will not prevent Urbain from dreaming big dreams for expanding his plantation, improving his food situation and home, and especially providing schooling for the children he supports. They and his sister Pascaline have formed a team (see photo).

loans.use: to maintain coffee plants and the mulch and to harvest the cherries

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a new sales agent for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums. She has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is beginning to work as door-to-door sales agents in Nairobi's slum communities. 

iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstoves, which have an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment.  Please help Daisy earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en: Karlen lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik Region of Armenia. He has been a devoted, skilled farmer for many years. He has cows, calves, bulls, sheep, lambs, and chickens. All his family's income comes from selling his farm products (milk, meat and eggs) and also by selling his land’s harvest (potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers). Karlen is married and has two sons. Karlen is thankful to Kiva lenders for his first loan. He now would like to take out a second loan. With his second loan, Karlen wants to purchase one more calf and animal fodder for his cattle. He will be very happy if Kiva lenders will be so kind to support him for the second time.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and animal fodder

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La señora  Nilda de 21 años de edad, tiene 2  hijos pequeños, con la ayuda de su esposo, se dedica al sustento de sus hijos con la actividad económica de la agricultura, con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su propia casa y terrenos para trabajar. Nilda y su pareja tienen aspiraciones grandes para brindar un buen futuro a sus hijos ya que son muy trabajadores en la producción de papa, arveja y maíz. Viven en una zona alejada. Actualmente la señora solicita un crédito para comprar semovientes (un par de bueyes) lo que facilitara su trabajo agrícola de la producción de papa aportando a la soberanía alimentaria de la región y al bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nilda is 21 years old and has two small children. 

With her husband's help, she provides for her children by working in agriculture. With a great deal of effort, she managed to acquire her own house and land to farm.

Nilda and her husband work very hard growing potatoes, peas, and corn, and they have high aspirations to give their children a good future.
 
They live in a remote area.

Currently, Nilda is requesting a loan to buy livestock (a pair of oxen), which will make her agricultural work—growing potatoes—easier. This will in turn contribute to the food sovereignty of the region and the well-being of her home.

loans.use: to buy livestock (a pair of oxen), which will make growing potatoes easier and, thus, improve the well-being of her home.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is a 63-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and pensioner mother-in-law. The family has a vineyard and produces wine for selling. In addition, they also have hens to produce eggs to sell. Makvala wants to purchase a tractor in order to cultivate additional family-owned land to grow a variety of vegetables. The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3200 GEL. With the loan, she will purchase the tractor. To generate additional income, the family will rent the tractor out. Makvala awaits your help, as the Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Rina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rina, de 48 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta segundo grado, vive solo con su pareja.

Rina, tiene 8 años de trabajar en un cafetín con lo cual ha llevado el sustento familiar. 

Rina, solicita el crédito para invertir en su cafetín y colocarlo en la entrada de su casa.
 
El Sueño de Rina, es en un futuro cercano, poder ampliar más el cafetín y así mejorar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rina is 48 years old, married, studied up to the second grade and lives just with her partner.

Rina has been working for 8 years in a snack stand which has maintained the support of the family.

Rina is requesting a loan to invest in her snack stand and to put it at the entrance of her house.
 
Rina's dream for the near future is to be able to expand the snack stand and thus improve her income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her snack stand and place it at the entrance of her house

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives in the Zugdidi district with her husband, two children, and a pensioner father-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have nut trees and sell the harvest locally. They also have twp hectares of agricultural land, which needs cultivation. 

Rusudan requested a loan for cultivating the land. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 6,000 GEL in order to purchase a tractor. As the tractor is purchased, Rusudan's husband will cultivate the land and they will purchase seeds of maize to grow. This will give them a chance to increase family income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-1B Group

texts.en:
Janaki, the woman standing first from right, lives with her husband and two children in a a small village of Sonepur district, Odisha, and is the only breadwinner of this small family. 

Janaki has been rearing goats for the past three years. She buys goats from the market and when the goats give birth to babies, she will sell them in the market at a profit. She has now requested a loan for 12,000 INR to enable her to buy more goats for her business. Janaki presently manages an income of 4,000 INR monthly from her business.

Janaki, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy goat kids for rearing. She is grateful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy goat kids for rearing

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-1C Group

texts.en:
Binodini, the lady standing first from right, and her husband have been operating their snacks/eateries business together for the past 14 years in Sonepur town in Sonepur district, Odisha. They earn an annual income of 48,000 INR from it. 

Binodini has successfully managed to repay her past loan taken for the business and has now requested a second loan for 12,000 INR for purchasing raw material like dal, flour, spices, preservatives, etc., for making a greater quantity of papads. Both Binodini and her husband are keen that their daughter is educated; her daughter is in the twelfth grade now.

Binodini, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase raw material like dal, flour, spices, preservatives, etc., for making a greater quantity of papads

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-1A Group

texts.en:
Sujata, the lady standing first from right, 46, lives in a small village of the Sonepur district with her husband and two children. Sujata's children are studying and her husband runs a tea stall. 

Sujata herself, though educated through the tenth class, has been running a grocery shop from her home for the last seven years to add to the family income, for lack of other opportunities. 

Sujata wants to expand her business, and to really benefit from increased inventory, she must buy stock in wholesale quantities. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying in bulk guards her against price spikes and hence ensure decent profits. However, this means she has to buy in 25 kg or 50 kg packs. She is, therefore, seeking a loan of 12,000 INR to bulk buy grocery items like edible oil, rice, and condiments for her shop.

Sujata, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR, and she will use her portion to buy grocery items like edible oil, rice, and condiments for her shop. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: buy grocery items like edible oil, rice, and condiments for her shop.

loans.name: Jhenry Jorge

texts.es:
Jhenry es un hombre de 50 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos varones de 23 y 26 años, y su negocio es la fabricación y venta de muebles metálicos.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, paciente, optimista, responsable  muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona norte de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por conectar a la ciudad mediante una autopista con la ciudad vecina, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Jhenry es de tez morena, cabello gris lo usa grande, ojos obscuros y usa lentes de aumento, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja como cirujana odontóloga y con sus hijos que son egresados de la universidad, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación y venta de muebles metálicos como; sillas, mesas, colgadores, pupitres y otros, actividad que realiza en su domicilio como taller y también venta. “comencé mi negocio porque sabía trabajar con metales, luego mis hijos me ayudaban a producir y vender…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es conocido porque la casa es propia y lleva bastante tiempo en el negocio, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es ampliar su producción para ofertar mayor cantidad y variedad de muebles, él desea realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo como; tubos metálicos, madera, revestimientos, pegamento, electrodos para soldadura y otros que utiliza en su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jhenry solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de muebles metálicos para aumentar su producción y oferta.
texts.en:
Jhenry is 50 years old; he is married and has two sons ages 23 and 26. His business is the manufacturing and sale of metal furniture. He is a good father, an entrepreneur, patient, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working. He developed his business in the northern area of the city, which is an area known for connecting the city with the neighboring city by way of a freeway. It is a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 2 and 14 degrees Celsius during the day.

Jhenry has dark skin, grey hair, dark eyes and eyeglasses, and he is of average height and physique. His native language is Aymará which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish for the general culture and to perform his job. He shares his life with his wife, who works as an oral surgeon, and with his sons who are college graduates. They live in their own house that is built of cement and brick with a metal roof, and they have potable water, electricity, and gas.

His business is the manufacturing and sale of metal furniture, such as chairs, hangers/racks, desks and other items. He works in his home for the shop and for the sales. He says, "I started my business because I knew how to work with metal, then my sons helped me to manufacture and sell." The advantage of his business is that it is known because it is his own house and he has been in business for a long time, and the drawback is the competition. 

His dream is to increase production in order to offer a greater amount and variety of furniture. He wants to purchase work materials such as metal tubing, wood, coverings, glue, welding electrodes, and other items used in his business. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 30 years that he has been in this business. For these reasons, Jhenry is requesting a loan to buy materials to make metal furniture and increase his production and offerings.

loans.use: to buy materials to make metal furniture and increase his production and offerings.

loans.name: Safya

texts.en: Safya is a 51-year-old widow from a village near Ramallah City, West Bank, Palestine. She is a mother of one son, who works as an employee in a shoe store. Safya has a child care center in her village. She loves her job and always thinks how she can improve it. Safya took a 2,000 USD loan from Kiva's partner, Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy new furniture and toys for her child care center, which will improve the center and make it more attractive.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and toys for her child care center

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia Juliana sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Juliana continues to dedicate herself to agriculture and cattle raising.

She is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, thus, as always, she promises to comply with her corresponding payments as outlined in the agreement. 

Juliana is a responsible and enterprising person who is successfully advancing her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy manure and fertilizers, among other necessary agricultural inputs.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata, a 38-year-old widowed mother of three, sells fruits and vegetables, a profitable enterprise that has enabled her to provide for the needs of her family. She is now requesting her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell so as to increase her income which she will use to pay her children's school fees.

Inviolata's hopes and dreams are to grow her business and open a big grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: María Oneida

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y viven en casa propia.

María, tiene 15 años de trabajar en la venta de pupusas, plato típico muy representativo de El Salvador, este negocio le ha permitido obtener buenas ingresos y ayudar para las necesidades de su familia.

El dinero del crédito será utilizado para comprar harina, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite y bebidas gaseosas para el negocio, ya que el dinero que tenía ahorrado, lo invirtió en mejorar su vivienda y ahora necesita dinero para comprar los insumos para el negocio.

El sueño principal de María, es mantener su negocio como uno de las mejores de la zona, con alimentos de buena calidad y una atención personalizada a sus cliente, lo cual le permitirá tener mejor clientela y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, studied up to the third grade, is in a relationship and they live in their own house.

Maria has been selling “pupusas” [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] for 15 years.  It is a typical dish and very representative of El Salvador.  This business has allowed her to obtain good earnings and to help with her family's necessities.

The money of the loan will be used to buy flour, cheese, pork rind, oil and soda drinks for the business since the money that she had saved she invested in improving her home and now she needs money to buy supplies for her business.

Maria's principal dream is to maintain her business as one of the best in the area, with good quality food and personalized attention to her customers which will permit her to have better customers and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, pork rind, oil and soda drinks for the business.

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Padmalaya, the lady standing on the right, and her husband together manage a decorating service that supplies tenting material, stage decoration items, public address systems, and other kinds of equipment commonly used for social functions. 

The couple have been running this service successfully or over three years. An amount of 12000 INR will help them invest in additional equipment, which in turn will enable them to supply the decorating materials to more customers. Though their daughter has just begun school, their family needs will continue to steadily increase, demanding more commitment from Padmalaya and improvement in household income.

Padmalaya, along with her group, has requested this loan of 24,000 INR and she will use her portion to buy additional equipment for her decorating service.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her decorating service.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos, 34-year-old married father of two, is a resident of Kitazigurukwa southern division, Rukungiri district. A new client, he has been selling goats as his main source of income for a period of six years.

Due to limited capital, Amos has turned to Ugafode for financial assistance and is requesting a loan of ug2,000,000 to buy more goats that he will sell,  thereby enabling him to meet all his family financial obligations and sustain his business.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-D Group

texts.en:
"Milk is the elixir of life."  It is so with human beings who consume it and those who rear cows, buffaloes, and goats. Shrimati Bhuli, the lady standing in the middle in the photo (39), a resident of Adal village in Sonepur district, desires to improve both the health of her family and the business of milk vending she is in. 

She wants to buy another buffalo. She already owns one. The additional milk yielding buffalo will be financed by this loan of 12,000 INR (her part of this loan). She has to advance her little savings in addition to this loan to buy the cattle. 

Shrimati Bhuli, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which Shrimati Bhuli's part will help her to buy a buffalo. Shrimati Bhuli is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Wilfredo  se dedica al negocio de carpinteria, el socio hace trabajos como sillas, puertas y ventanas, el socio trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de carpinteria.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar madera y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Amanecer 15 De Agosto.”  The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, belonging to the province of La Convencion and the department of Cusco.

The member Wilfredo works as a carpenter.  He makes items such as chairs, doors and windows. He works from 8:00 AM until 5:00 PM.  He has several years in this business and it is going well.  His dream is to expand the carpentry business.  He is asking for a loan to buy wood and tools.

He is happy for the loan and commits to making the loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools

loans.name: Widjai

texts.en:
Widjai thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice cultivation. He repaid his previous loan fully, and with the profits he rented a new rice plot to increase his income.

Widjai wants to continue rice production and is requesting a SRD 12.000 loan for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts to to repair and maintain his taxi-vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her meet the milk supply demands of her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado en San Salvador, está a acompañado y solo su pareja depende directamente de él.

José, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a la comercialización de mariscos, este oficio lo aprendió de unos amigos y por la necesidad de ayudar con los ingresos a su familia decidio ejercerlo; observo que es una actividad que le permite obtener buenos ingresos para la familia.

El dinero será utilizada para comprar más mariscos como pescado, camarones, langosta, entre otros, porque se acerca la temporada de vacaciones de semana santa y hay mucha afluencia de turistas en la zona y tiene oportunidad de vender mucho más sus productos.

El sueño principal de Luis, es hacer crecer su negocio, vendiendo productos de calidad a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old, studied up to the ninth grade in San Salvador, is in a relationship and only his partner depends directly on him.

For 14 years Jose has worked marketing seafood.  He learned this trade from some friends and due to the necessity of helping with the family income he decided to do it.  He observed that it is an occupation that allows him to obtain a good income for the family. 

The money will be used to buy more seafood such as fish, shrimp, and lobster among others.  Since the Easter vacation season is approaching and there is a large influx of tourists in the area, he has the opportunity to sell much more seafood.

His main dream is to have his business grow, selling quality products to his customers and thus obtain better earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy seafood such as fish, shrimp, and lobster among others

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 26-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Christopher sells bananas, and at the same time, he grows tomatoes that add more income. He is faced with challenges of little capital that hinder the progress of his business. Besides that, he hopes to have enough capital to boost his business. 

Christopher has asked for a loan to help him buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, de 73 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, es jornalero, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a la crianza de aves, es padre de siete hijos, de los cuales todos tienen sus propios grupos familiares.

Manuel, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 50 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, decidio dedicarse a estas actividades, debido a que le generaba las ganancias suficientes para ir sobreviviendo con su familia; la distancia de su casa hasta su trabajo es de tres kilómetros, recorrido que hace en caballo, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. y regresa a casa a las 3:00 p.m para ayudar a su esposa en su casa.

Manuel, está solicitando el crédito para comprar dos vacas, él espera tener ganancias y mejorar la producción, para poder darle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.

Manuel, sueña con tener más vacas y lograr una mejor producción para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 73 year old day laborer with a first grade education.  He is married, and his wife is engaged in doing the household chores, and raising chickens.  He is the father of seven children, and they all have their own families.  

Manuel has been engaged in farming and raising livestock for fifty years, work that he learned from his parents.  He decided to engage in these activities because they generate enough income to ensure his family’s survival.  The distance from his home to his job is three kilometers, a journey he makes on horseback.  He begins work at 7:00 a.m. and returns home at 3:00 p.m. to help his wife at home.

He is requesting this loan to purchase two cows, and he hopes to earn profits through improved production in order to provide his wife with a better quality of life.  Manuel dreams of having more cows, and achieving better production, which will give him more profits.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a new sales agent at iSmart, an organization working to address high unemployment among youth and women in Kenya's slum communities. Eunice attended iSmart's sales and marketing training and is now working as a sales agent. She sells solar lamps and clean cookstoves to residents in her community. 

Clean cookstoves have an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce toxic smoke and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment. Solar lamps are a cleaner and safer alternative to other forms of off-grid lighting such as kerosene or candles.  

Please help Eunice earn a living and sell these beneficial products in Nairobi's slums.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in Nairobi's slums.

loans.name: Miriorky Alejandra

texts.es:
Miriorky Alejandra, es una joven estudiante de Medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Miriorky  Alejandra, tengo 17 años de edad, vivo en de la ciudad de Puerto Plata, donde nací y crecí junto a mis dos hermanos y mis padres. Mi madre es empleada privada pero con ingresos muy mínimos y  es madre soltera. Mi Padre no trabaja, por motivos de salud está inhabilitado para trabajar. Estoy realizando el primer ciclo de Medicina en la Universidad de Santiago (UTESA), la misma la escogí  porque me gustaría ser una gran doctora para ayudar a mi familia y a todo el que lo necesite. 

El obtener  este   préstamo me permitirá lograr mis estudios,  porque mi madre no tiene los recursos necesarios para pagar mi carrera universitaria, de no lograrlo el préstamo no podría continuar en la universidad, y  mis sueños no los alcanzaría.

Dentro de mi meta académica es ser Médico Profesional, para así sentirme realizada y poder ayudar en especial a mi madre y ser un ejemplo de superación para mi familia. Luego de terminar mi carrera me gustaría hacer una especialidad en el área de cirugía y pediatría
texts.en:
Miriorky Alejandra is a young woman studying Medicine.  She is asking for a loan to be able to cover her educational expenses.  

This is her story:  My name is Miriorky Alejandra.  I am 17 years old.  I live in the city of Puerto Plata, where I was born and grew up with my siblings and parents.  My mother is a private employee but with a very low income; she is a single mother.  My father doesn’t work due to health reasons; he isn’t able to work.  

I am completing the first cycle of classes in Medicine in the University of Santiago (UTESA).  I chose it because I would like to be a great doctor in order to help my family and everyone who needs it.

Getting this loan will allow me to achieve my studies because my mother doesn’t have the financial resources needed to pay for my university degree.  If I don’t get the loan I won’t be able to continue on in the university and my dreams wouldn’t be realized.

My academic goal is to be a professional physician so that, in this way, I can feel fulfilled and can help my mother especially.  I can be an example of self-improvement for my family.  After finishing my degree, I would like to specialize in the area of surgery and pediatrics.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old. He is married to Wanjiru who is a farmer and they are blessed with one child, aged 5 years old. He has had a farming business for seven years earning a monthly income of KES 65,000. 

He has borrowed his first loan of KES 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase farm inputs like farm gloves, gumboots, as well as to build a milking crush. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to buy food for the family, pay school fees for his children, as well as cater for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like farm gloves, gumboots, and to build a milking crush.

loans.name: Cfjdt 23 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 23 est un sous groupe affilié à la Convergence des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 06 personnes dont 5 femmes et un jeune homme qui habitent tous dans le même village de Tassette. Ils se regroupent chaque fin de mois pour organiser des tontines et discuter des points stratégiques pour lutter contre la pauvreté. Ils pratiquent les mêmes activités et prennent leur destin en main. La présidente s'appelle FATOU; elle est reconnue sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter du mil, le mais, le sorgho et l'arachide pour les stocker et les vendre pendant les périodes de soudures (durant l'hivernage). Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 18h. A l'avenir, elle souhaite avoir un grand magasin de stockage pour renforcer ses marchandises et diversifier ses produits
texts.en:
CFJDT 23 is a sub-group affiliated with the "Convergence des Jeunes et Femmes pour le Développement de Tassette" (Women and Youth Movement for the Development of Tassette).

The group is comprised of six people (5 women and one young man) who all live in the village of Tassette. They get together at the end of each month in order to organize group loan activities and discuss strategies for combatting poverty. They all are involved in the same businesses and take their destinies into their own hands. 

The president is named Fatou. She has her hand raised in the photo. She is a married mother who works in cereal sales. She is asking for a loan for this amount to buy millet, corn, sorghum, and peanuts. She will hold these as inventory until she sells them during the rainy season. 

She helps her husband with the daily expenses and their children's schooling costs. Her workday goes from 6 am to 6 pm. In the future, she would like to have a large warehouse to reinforce her goods and diversify her products.

loans.use: buy cereals that will be held as inventory and then sold.

loans.name: Fener Daniel

texts.es: Fener es un hombre que día a día trabaja para lograr tener mejores condiciones de vida, para él y su familia. Él se dedica desde hace 3 años y medio a la comercialización de piedras canteras de forma ambulante en diferentes departamentos del país.  Él solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir en la compra de llantas para el camión que utiliza para ir a vender sus productos. Las metas y planes de este hombre emprendedor son mejorar su camión y seguir invirtiendo en las piedras canteras para comercializarlas y así seguir creciendo y tener una mejor economía.
texts.en:
Fener is a man who works every day to improve his and his family's living conditions.

For the past three years, he has been making a living as a traveling salesman, selling "cantera stones" (a natural volcanic quarried stone that is porous and lightweight) in the country's different departments. 

He is requesting a loan because he wants to purchase tires for the truck he uses to transport the products he sells. 

The goals and plans of this enterprising man are to improve his truck and to keep on investing in "cantera stones" to sell them, so he can keep on growing his business and have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy tires for the truck he uses to transport the products he sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Baha

texts.en: Baha is a 25-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father has a blacksmith workshop. Baha also helps his father in his work. Baha would like to improve the family business and increase productivity. He took a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy new tools for the blacksmith workshop.

loans.use: to buy new tools for the blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy  pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia sigue dedicándose a la  ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en: The borrower, Nancy, belongs to the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank and she continues to raise livestock. She has been in business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. Nancy is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the established payment terms. She hopes to continue working on her business, which is going well thanks to her efforts. At the same time, she continues working in agriculture. Nancy is requesting this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen is 32 years old and she lives with her family in the village Vanek of Syunik region. Ashkhen has vocational education and she graduated from a college of management. For several years she worked as an accountant, but now she runs a farm in her native village.  

On her farm she manages all the work with the help of her husband, who works also as a driver. Her farm has cows, calves, pigs and beehives. Her cute vegetable garden gives her a harvest of potatoes, cabbages and onions.  She sells all her farm products at the wholesale market to her regular customers. Her farm’s honey is perfect, and she also earns income from selling it.

She greatly hopes that her first partnership with Kiva will be productive for her farm, as she plans to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for her agricultural activities, and she also wants to buy several bee families.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for her agricultural activities and to buy several bee families.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Doure Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALI  est responsable du groupe DOURE.  Il  est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05  ans et le moins âgé a  01 an.  Aucun  enfant ne  va à l’école et il a 03  personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage et du jardinage  depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les  marchés  environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 sacs d’engrais et 01 mouton.
Il   veut utiliser les  bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne devenir un grand  commerçant.
texts.en:
Mr. Ali is responsible for the Doure group. He is married and the father of two children between the ages of one and five. Neither of his children goes to school and he has three dependents.

Mr. Ali has been raising livestock and doing gardening for 5 years.  He buys his supplies in the neighboring markets. With the money he earns, he will buy three bags of fertilizer and one sheep.

He will use the loan to help his family and pay for his children’s schooling. He would like to become an important trader.

loans.use: buy three bags of fertilizer and one sheep.

loans.name: Omorden Bor Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Omorden Bor Group, and they are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of five members. The members’ businesses include soft drinks, silver shine, banku (cook cassava and corn paste), sewing accessories and seamstress. This loan will help their small businesses, including Jennifer's. 

This is her fourth loan from ID Ghana, having joined at a friend’s invitation. Jennifer has a business providing seamstress services to her customers, and says that she started this business by learning as an apprentice. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more materials, lining, and sewing accessories, to sew and sell to customers. This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. She is married and has one child. When asked what she likes abut ID Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total amount of GHS 2,400 to better their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more materials, lining, and sewing accessories, to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La socia Ricarda pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia Ricarda sigue dedicándose  a la ganadería y a la producción de lácteos como leche, yogurt, queso, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
The borrower, Ricarda, belongs to the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank. She is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

Ricarda continues raising livestock and producing dairy products such as milk, yogurt, and cheese. She has been in business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She continues to sell her products to customers who request them. In this way, she gets her family ahead. Ricarda is requesting this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some products like chocolate and chips to sell using his rickshaw.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a very hardworking, married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has five children and deals in cattle trading as his main business. He gets additional income from farming. He was forced to join these businesses by the urge to be self-employed. 

Minu will use the loan to buy cows to sell on Easter holidays. He wishes to have a strong capital base that can enable him to also trade in goats, so as to have several sources of income despite the challenge of price fluctuations of cows.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production, to enable her to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to her customers daily.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a new client to the institution; he is married with four children and three are attending school. He does cattle fattening as his major source of income. He has done this business for over nine years, and he also has a video hall as an additional income source. 

David has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy more cows to fatten, so as to earn more income. David thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance, which he hopes will help him to expand his business. He appreciates UGAFODE for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, nunca fue a la escuela, su estado civil es viuda, solo vive con uno de sus hijos, porque los otros 2 tienen sus propias casa.

Rosa, tiene una pupuseria desde hace 3 años, en la pupuseria trabaja con un hijo y su nuera.

Ella necesita el crédito, para comprar gaseosas, verduras, mesas y arreglar el local donde vende pupusas.

Los Sueños de Rosa son, seguir trabajando en su pupuseria y comprar los insumos por mayor para ahorrar y ampliar la pupuseria.
texts.en:
Rosa never went to school and she is a widow. She lives with only one of her children because the other 2 have their own houses. Rosa has had a pupusería (a shop selling stuffed corn tortillas) for 3 years. She works with her son and daughter-in-law at the pupusería.

Rosa needs this loan to buy soft drinks, vegetables, and tables and to repair her shop where she sells pupusas. Her dreams are to keep working at her pupusería and to buy ingredients at wholesale in order to save and expand her pupusería.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, and tables and to repair her shop where she sells pupusas.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old, married to George, and together they have been blessed with four children, aged between 20 and 10 years.  She is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 14 years earning a monthly income of KES 11,000.

Victoria has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 with VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, so as to increase the milk supply in order to generate additional income.  She hopes to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, to increase the amount of milk supply.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This young woman is 32 years old and lives with her big family in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. Her name is Ani. She is a mother of three children; she has two sons and a daughter. Ani’s husband does his best to provide his family with minimum living conditions, and at this period he solves that problem by going to work abroad in the Russian Federation. So for several months, he leaves his lovely wife alone with the farm and its care. Ani mainly does all the work alone since her children are too small to help her. 

In her farm she has cows, bulls, pigs, sheep and chickens. As a result of long hard work all day on her farm, she sells some assortment of farm products like milk, macun (national dairy-product) and eggs. Ani is already a master in agricultural activities. She cultivates potatoes and greens, which she sells right from her house to re-sellers.

Ani asks for this loan, as she wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer for her agricultural occupations, and also animal fodder for her farm cattle. She is thankful and greatly hopes to be supported by the kind Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer for her agricultural occupations, and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Paulina Doris

texts.es:
La socia Paulina continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche, la socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo la leche a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo e esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche.
texts.en:
Paulina continues to sell milk. Paulina belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank and she is thankful for the opportunity provided through it. She also promises to make her repayments on schedule. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She continues to sell milk to her customers who ask her, and this is the way in which she moves her family forward.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy milk.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz Marina continua dedicándose a la ganadería y agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de leche, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando en sus negocios para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Bartolomé de Tambo Real communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

Luz Marina continues to work in ranching and farming. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time. At the same time, she continues to sell milk. She wants to be able to continue working at her businesses in order to keep supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds, among others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds, among other items

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу, 38 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Рысбубу высшее образование, работает учителем. Также она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день прибыль Рысбубу составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, также на арендованном земельном наделе мерою 2,0 ГА она выращивает фасоль, которую реализует оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Она является участником группы "Нур", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Рысбубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Rysbubu is 38, married, and has three children. She has a college education and works as a teacher. She has also been farming for many years. She currently earns around 12,000 som (KGS) per month. She has two cows and rents 2.0 hectares of land where she plants beans to sell wholesale. In order to expand her business, Rysbubu applied for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She is a member of the “Noor” group, which consists of two other people. She plans to use her profits to invest in expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Yojana Carolina

texts.es:
Yojana, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y vive junto a su pareja y su hija que está estudiando.

Yojana, tiene un año de trabajar en la venta de mariscos, lo aprendió de su familia, ella vende conchas y ostras en la playa, su pareja es pescador y también se involucra en el negocio.

Yojana, necesita el financiamiento para fortalecer el negocio de ostras y conchas, ya que se acerca la temporada de vacaciones de semana santa y vende bastante con los turistas.

Los sueños de Yojana son, continuar con su negocio y buscar estrategias para que sea rentable y sostenible a lo largo de los años, para que le genere los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yojana is 21 years old and has a seventh-grade education. She is married and lives with her husband and their school-aged daughter. 

Yojana has for the past year been running a  shellfish business, selling oysters and conches at a beach.  Her family taught her the shellfish business, and her husband, a fisherman, also works with her. 

Yojana needs a loan to strengthen her oyster and conch business as the Easter holiday is approaching and she's anticipating strong sales to tourists. 

Yojana hopes to keep running her business and find strategies to ensure its long-term profitability and sustainability. She hopes that her business will provide income for her family.

loans.use: strengthen her business selling oysters and conches.

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en: Doaa is 25 years old from Minia. She is married with two children. Her husband has a small home supplies project and it is the only source of income to the family. She decided to help her husband with the family income. So she took a tailoring and sewing course and bought a sewing machine and, temporarily, used it in her husband's store. Doaa looks forward to expanding her project so she requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy two other sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy two different sewing machines.

loans.name: Cfjdt 28 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 20 fait parti de la Convergence des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 5 femmes et de 2 hommes qui habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent les mêmes activités. Chaque fin de mois ils se réunissent pour organiser des tontines pour le développement du village et discuter des stratégies pour lutter contre la pauvreté. Madame AMY est la présidente, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est divorcée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées de 1ères nécessités comme le riz, le sucre, le lait, le café, le savon, et l'huile. Elle prend en charge toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 15 ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 21h. Avec l'aide de l'institution, elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation générale pour augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
The CFJDT20 group belongs to the Association of Women and Young People for the Development of Tassette. The group is composed of five women and two men living in the same neighborhood and engaged in the same business activities. At the end of each month they meet to arrange "tontines" [community savings group] for the development of their village and to discuss strategies for fighting poverty. 

Mrs. Amy, the one raising her hand in the photo, is the group's leader. She is divorced and has dependent children. She works as a vendor selling staple foods such as rice, sugar, milk, soap and oil. She takes care of all everyday expenses of her household as well as the school fees of her children. She has over 15 years of experience in business. She starts her work day at 8 AM and ends at 9 PM. With the help of microfinance institution, she would like to open a grocery store in order to diversify her merchandise and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, soap and milk for resale.

loans.name: Los Ruiseñores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS RUISEÑORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mirian Eva ella es soltera y tiene 54 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de le reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the "Los Ruiseñores" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

The borrower is Mirian Eva. She is single, 54 years old, and has 3 children. She works at her business selling grains. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. Mirian Eva works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell grains. She is requesting this loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The members who are attached to the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting because they asked permission due to work. The other members sell animals, grains, have a grocery store, and sell food.

Mirian Eva is grateful to those who are supporting this dream and she is committed to paying her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: in order to buy a herd of cattle

loans.name: Caciana

texts.es:
La socia Caciana pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de producción y venta de queso, leche y yogurt, la socia está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo  de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche,yogurth entre otros.
texts.en:
Caciana belongs to the San Bartolomé de Tambo Real communal bank. She continues to make and sell cheese, milk, and yogurt. She is happy with the loan and she promises to make her repayments on time. She has been in this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day, since this is how she moves her family forward.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy milk and yogurt, among other items.

loans.use: to buy milk and yogurt, among other items

loans.name: Gulshaiyr

texts.ru: Гулшайыр 35 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей школьного возраста. У Гулшайыр среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулшайыр в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, теленок, жеребенок, 10 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,60 ГА, где Гулшайыр выращивает клевер и перец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка и обработку земли. Доходы от кредита Гулшайыр планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и образование своих детей.
texts.en: Gulshaiyr is 35, married, and has four school-age children. She has a high school education and has earned the main source of income for her family for many years by raising livestock and planting crops. Thanks to her hard work, Gulshaiyr currently has a cow, a calf, a foal and ten sheep. She also has a 1.60 hectare plot of land where she grows clover and pepper. In order to expand her business she applied for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a young bull and cultivate her land. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a young bull and cultivate her land

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Presentación continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia a la vez continua vendiendo leche a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca y alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Bartolomé de Tambo Real communal bank. The bank is located in Anta province in the department of Cusco.

Presentación continues to work in ranching. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments on schedule. At the same time, she continues to sell milk to all of her customers who ask her. She wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy a cow and food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow and food for her animals

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Eusebia, la socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de  ganadería principalmente a la crianza de ganado vacuno, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas a la vez la socia se dedica  a la  agricultura produciendo productos como papa, habas y maíz, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca y alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the San Bartolome de Tambo Real community bank.  She balances her daily activities with her livestock business which mainly raises cattle.  She is grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business and she promises to make her repayments on time.  She also works as a farmer, producing products like potato, beans, and corn.  This is the way that she moves forward.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow and feed for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
El socio Segundo  se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carro donde hace servicio urbano, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Segundo continues working at his transportation business.  He has a car that he uses to provide taxi service in his city.  He works from 6:00am until 7:00pm.  He has done this work for many years and it is going well.  His dream is to have a new car.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase tires for his car.

Segundo is happy with the loan and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his car.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg-1C Group

texts.en:
Mami, the woman standing in the middle in the photo, 46, lives with her husband and daughter in a small village of Sonepur district, Odisha. Her husband is a daily wage worker, and both of them have worked hard all these years to ensure a college degree for their daughter. For this, Mami has been running a grocery shop from her home since seven years ago to generate income. 

She has taken loans previously from Peoples Forum and has a very successful repayment history. Currently, Mami is seeking a loan of 12,000 INR to invest in her shop. She wants to add oils, pulses and other condiments to expand her business. She often loses money due to price fluctuations in the wholesale prices. Having lump sum capital will equip her to buy items when prices are more favorable.

Mami, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy oils, pulses and other condiments to expand her business. She would like to say thanks to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy oils, pulses and other condiments to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, de 37 años de edad, es agricultor, no tuvo la oportunidad de poder estudiar por su situacion económicas, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y también a la crianza de pollos, él es padre de tres hijos de 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, los tres estudian en el cantón donde viven.

Juan, se dedica a la ganadería y a cultivar hortalizas desde hace 10 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio, la distancia que camina para llegar a su trabajo es de tres kilómetros y su día de trabajo comienza a las 7:00 a.m. y regresa a casa a las 5:00 p.m. para ayudar a su esposa en las tareas del hogar.

Juan, está solicitando el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera, de esta manera espera alimentar a sus hijos y obtener ganancias en un futuro por la comercialización de la misma.

Juan, sueña con poder darles la oportunidad a sus hijos para que estudien la carrera que deseen, además, sueña con poder ampliar su casa, para darle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 37 years old, is a farmer. He did not have the opportunity to be able to go to school due to his economic situation. He is married and his wife sells fruits and vegetables and also raises chickens. He is the father of three children aged 7, 10, and 14. All three go to school in the canton where they live.

For 10 years, Juan has worked in ranching and has grown vegetables. He learned the work from his parents, who had always done it. The distance he walks in order to get to his work is three kilometers. His work day starts at 7:00 a.m. and he returns home at 5:00 p.m. to help his wife with the household chores.

Juan is asking for the loan in order to buy a milk cow. In this way he hopes to feed his children and obtain income in the future from selling it.

Juan dreams of being able to give his children opportunity so they can study for whatever degree they want. He also dreams of being able to expand his house in order to make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 30-year-old lady from Kisumu who is married and supports three people in her family. She has asked for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers so as to earn more income.

She will use the anticipated income to educate her children.

Her dreams and hopes are to have a stable business so as to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell to her customers to earn more income

loans.name: Minirissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Minirissa works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Minirissa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Minirissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Manabi

texts.en:
Manabi is 27 years old and hails from a very small village of Sonepur district, Odisha, with her husband and two children. She has managed a chicken rearing activity for the past three years. The chickens when they breed are then sold for chicken and eggs. 

She is requesting her first loan for 12,000 INR to buy additional chicks, feed and medicine and to construct a brooder so she can expand her business. She will then be able to support her husband in contributing to the family income, which in turn will help them build a secure future together.

She is very happy to have this loan and would like to thank Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks, feed and medicine and to construct a brooder so she can expand her business

loans.name: Ragomzanga De Silmissin Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALIFOU  est responsable du groupe RAGOMZANGA DE SILMISSIN.  Il  est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14  ans et le moins âgé a  03 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 10 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’élevage  depuis 07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les  marchés  environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 moutons et 02 cochons.
Il   veut utiliser les  bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne devenir un grand  commerçant et aller dans les villages éloignés.
texts.en:
Mr. SALIFOU is the official of the group RAGOMZANGA DE SILMISSIN. He is a married father of five children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 3. Four children go to school. He has ten persons to support. 

Mr. SALIFOU has been raising livestock for seven years. He gets his supplies at nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase 2 sheep and 2 hogs. He wants to use the profits from the loan to help his family and to pay for his children’s schooling. His ambition is to become a major merchant and to go to distant villages.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep and 2 hogs

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 51-year-old married man. He lives in Mtskheta district with his wife and two children. Gocha is an artisan, but now he is unemployed. The only source of income for his family is his wife's small monthly income from working as a cleaner. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3,000 USD. With the received credit, Gocha will purchase a special apparatus to paint walls and renovate houses. He is experienced in this field as a hired worker, and now he plans to start his own business. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a special apparatus to paint walls and renovate houses

loans.name: Moner

texts.en:
Moner is a 25-year-old single man who lives with his family in a very humble house which lacks of a lot of home furniture and home appliances, and most of them are very old. He is the sole employee inside his family. Despite the fact that he receives a salary, it is not enough to furnish a house. 

Therefore, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary furniture for his house. By this loan, all the members of the family will feel happy because if any guest reaches their house, they feel very ashamed because of that old and torn furniture. By this loan, Moner will acquire new blankets, a bed, and cushions to change the old ones to make some of the necessary improvements for the house.

Moner hopes to help his father and brothers to rent a better home than the current one because it is small.

loans.use: to purchase some of the necessary furniture for his house.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
O senhor Alberto tem 44 anos de idade, é casado com duas esposas pai de 5 filhos, 3 dos quais a estudar e outros ainda menores. Além dos filhos sustenta 2 enteados que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, barrotes, portas, chapas de zinco para ampliar uma dependência.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são fazer uma oficina de serralharia na sua casa e desenvolver a criação de porcos.
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz  poupanca e contara com mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Alberto is 44 years old and married. He has two wives and five children, three of whom study and the others are still underage. Aside from his children, he also supports two stepchildren who live with him in a house that he owns.
He states that with the amount of the loan he will purchase cement, beams, doors and zinc plates so he can enlarge a room.
His hopes and dreams for the future are to set up a locksmith's shop at his house and start a pig farm.
He states that his challenge is the lack of funds. In order to overcome this situation, he has a savings account. He will apply for more loans in order to achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams, doors and zinc plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics, bags, and shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Kiswendsida De Ballole Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALI  est responsable du groupe KISWENDSIDA DE BALLOLE.  Il  est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a  07 mois. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 06 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait la restauration depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 sacs de riz et du bois.
Il   veut utiliser les  bénéfices du prêt pour aider sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne améliorer son activité et devenir un grossiste.
texts.en:
Mr. ALI is the official of the group KISWENDSIDA DE BALLOLE. He is a married father of five children. The oldest is 10 years old, and the youngest is 7 months old. Four children go to school. He has six persons to support. 

Mr. SALIFOU has been in the restaurant business for fifteen years. He gets his supplies from the market in his neighborhood. With the money granted, he intends to purchase 2 sacks of rice and some firewood. He wants to use the profits from the loan to help his family and to pay for his children’s schooling. His ambition is to improve his business and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and and some firewood

loans.name: Radjendre

texts.en:
Radjendre is very happy with the help of the Kiva lenders and thanks them for such a great job!

He repaid his loan to the Kiva lenders late, because the price of the rice production was very low and he couldn't save much. Radjendre is very sorry for the delay.

This season, he wants to continue rice production and therefore he needs SRD 8.000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and promise to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 42 years old, married to Jackson and they are blessed with three children. She sells clothes and the business has been profitable. Her spouse, who is a farmer, supports the family by providing additional income. She also supports five people in her family.

She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more dresses, skirts and blouses and other second-hand clothes and she will use the anticipated profits to expand her current business.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase dresses, skirts, blouses and other second-hand clothes and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.pt:
O senhor Timóteo  tem 52 anos de idade, é casado, pai de 4 filhos 2 dos quais maiores de idade e frequentam o ensino secundário, os outros são menores e não estudam e vivem todos com ele em casa própria. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar  acuçar, óleo, amendoim, feijão, tomate e farinha para a sua barraca.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são crescer no negócio e se tornar um empresário de sucesso.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz  xitique mensal como forma de poupar e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Timóteo is 52 years old and married. He has four children, two of whom are adults and attend secondary school, and the others are underage and don't study. They all live with him in a house that he owns.
He states that with the amount of the loan he will purchase sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, beans, tomatoes and flour for his stall.
His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow in his business and become a successful entrepreneur.
He states that his challenge is the lack of funds. In order to overcome this situation, he does rotating credit as a way of saving money. He will apply for more loans so he can achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, beans, tomatoes and flour.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.pt:
O senhor Abilio tem 27 anos de idade, é docente numa Escola Primária e Completa e, é também estudante Universitário. Vive em casa da sua mãe que é camponesa e cuida da mesma.
